title: SchoolGymCheerleaderInduction0
text:
You nod and sit down, facing the other girls in the semi-circle. Britney grins broadly at you. Stacey offers you a polite smile. Reagan barely meets your eyes.

 

 “Firstly,” Christina begins. “Welcome to the cheerleader squad. That’s your uniform. Make sure you wear it for practice. I took the liberty of guessing your size.”

 

 You finger the material gently. It feels soft and new. 

 

 “That, however,” Christina continues, “is just the beginning. You see, Emily, the cheerleader team has a certain role at Charlton. What I’m about to say might shock you, but there’s a reason we’re so selective. We have a responsibility to our school. Our community.”

 

 She looks around at the other cheerleaders with a smile, then turns back to you, holding out the palm of her hand. In it is an orb of yellow energy, floating in the air, casting a warm glow around it. Your body tingles. You recognise the sensation. 

 

 “You see, Emily,” she repeats. “Magic is real.”

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>

 “What?” you stammer, putting all your efforts into sounding surprised.

 

 Christina grins. The orb rises up out of her hand and circles around the semi-circle. “Magic,” she repeats. “The stuff of fairy tales and legend. It’s true. All of it.”

 

 The orb of energy bobbles in the air for a moment longer, then shoots back into Christina’s palm disappearing. She smiles, waiting for you to speak.

 

 “What was that?” you say, again emphasising your ignorance. 

 

 “A simple illumination spell,” Christina replies. “Just a small trick. I can teach you how to do it, if you like. I can teach you a lot of things.”

 

 “If she’s got the talent,” Reagan mutters under her breath. 

 

 Christina shoots her a look. “She has,” she tells her. “I can feel it.”

 

 Then, Christina looks back at you, composing herself once more. “But first. Questions. You must have many.”

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 You dramatically sigh. “I can’t say I’m surprised.” 

 

 Christina’s eyebrow raises. “Oh?”

 

 “This school,” you tell her. “There’s a lot of strange things that happen here.”

 

 She studies you for a moment, then Christina looks around to her peers with a smile. “I told you she was smart.”

 

 “Dangerously so,” Reagan mutters.

 

 Christina closes her hand around the orb and it fizzles out of sight. “You’re right, of course. Magic pervades this school. In time, you’ll be able to see it. Use it. Manipulate it. We do far more than make a glow ball.”

 

 “You must have questions, though,” she continues. “We shall answer anything you ask. You’ve earned it.”

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 Christina waits patiently for you to speak. The rest of the cheerleaders watch you with varying degrees of interest.

 

 Actions

 
 <>

 
 <>

 
 <>

 
 <>

 
 <>

 
 <>

 
 <>

 Christina nods and looks around the group. “Then we should begin.”

 

 The statement elicits a quiet shriek from Britney, a smile from Stacey and a scowl from Reagan. 

 

 “Now Emily,” Christina says slowly. “Once you join us, there’s no going back. You must make a solemn vow that you will do as we all agree, perform our duties to the school to the best of your magical affinity, and above all, tell not a soul about what you learn here. Is that understood?”

 

 “What if I don’t want to?” you say, testing where Christina’s boundaries lie.

 

 “We have our ways to keep you quiet,” she says. “Nothing violent. Just preying a thought or two from your mind. As an example - Britney, who sings Flaunt It?”

 

 “Oh I know this one! Lexi Star!” Britney squeals.

 

 Christina gives Britney a hard look. At first it looks like a disapproving stare, but then you feel it. Energy builds up in Christina and ebbs out towards Britney’s brain. 

 

 “Again,” Christina commands. “Who sings Flaunt It?”

 

 Britney goes to speak, but pauses as her mouth opens. A confused look crosses her face. “I don’t know,” she says, quietly.

 

 Satisfied, Christina turns to you. “No harm, no foul. Quick and painfree. So Emily, you have a choice. Do you join us and learn how to perform magic, or do you return to your life none the wiser?”

 

 You glance at Britney, still struggling with confusion. Then turn back to Christina. If she tries that on you, will she notice that you can resist? And if not, will you forget what you’ve learned?

 

 Actions

 <>

 <>

 
 
 “Okay then,” you tell Christina. “I accept.”

 

 There is measured relief from all of the cheerleaders, except Reagan. Britney actually claps.

 

 "Excellent," Christina says. "To whet your appetite, let me show you how to send someone to sleep. And how to make them forget. There's a number of the quarterbacks that have experienced this one far too many times."

 

 "Jake gets so drunk, he doesn't need a spell to black out," Britney comments. Christina shoots her a dark look.

 

 "This will take some time," Christina tells you after gaining some composure. "But it will be worth it. Trust me."

 
 "I want to join," you tell Christina. "I accept."

 

 There is measured relief from all of the cheerleaders, except Reagan. Britney actually claps.

 

 “Excellent,” Christina says. “To whet your appetite, let me show you how to send someone to sleep. And how to make them forget. There’s a number of the quarterbacks that have experienced this one far too many times.”

 

 “Jake gets so drunk, he doesn’t need a spell to black out,” Britney comments. Christina shoots her a dark look.

 

 “This will take some time,” Christina tells you after gaining some composure. “But it will be worth it. Trust me.”

 
 

 Actions

 
 <>

 <>
 

 “I need some time to think about it,” you tell her.

 

 Christina’s smile drops away from her face. Her eyes flick to Reagan, who raises an eyebrow in response. Stacey looks off to the side, avoiding looking at you. And Britney gulps.

 

 “Very well,” Christina says, after a moment. “I’ll give you that leniency. Come back when you’ve considered whether to join us. But I must warn you, Emily. I’m taking a big risk here. If you tell anyone what we’ve discussed, it won’t just be your memories you lose.”

 

 You stare at Christina, then nod. “Thank you,” you say quietly. 

 

 “We’ll be seeing you again,” Christina says as a farewell. “I hope.”

 

 Standing up from the mat, you make a hasty exit to the gym door, not daring to look back. Butterflies flutter in your stomach. You can’t tell if you’ve escaped a fate worse than death, or missed an opportunity to learn more than you could dream of.

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 Christina tells you to sit cross-legged on the mat and relax. You listen to her voice, telling you to breathe in, and breathe out.

 

 As you fall into a sway, you start to feel something inside of you. A brittle thing, sharp and spiky. It burns your lungs and you gasp for air.

 

 “You feel it, don’t you?” you hear Christina whisper. “Power. Inside of you.”

 

 As you concentrate on the feeling, the energy inside grows sharper and larger. Euphoria flows through you, connecting your sense to the ever-growing sensation of raw energy flowing through your body.

 

 “Now,” Christina says. “Open your eyes, and concentrate on Britney.”

 

 "Me again?" you hear Britney pipe up. "No fair!" It takes everything to not lose concentration as she’s shushed by the rest of the group.

 

 “Repeat these words”, you hear Christina say after a few moments. “*Fall asleep, and let your memories drift as you slumber.*”

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 Not wanting to reveal how much you already know, you decide to play along with Christina. You do as she tells you, sitting cross-legged on the mat.

 

 The technique is all-too familiar. Christina tells you to concentrate on your breathing, focusing on the feeling in your body. You quickly start to feel the energy building within you.

 

 Under Christina’s direction though, it feels different. Instead of a warm bath, it feels brittle and sharp. You feel as though you’re breathing hot and dense air, as if smoke was clogging your lungs. 

 

 “You feel it, don’t you?” you hear Christina whisper. “Power. Inside of you.”

 

 As you concentrate on the feeling, the energy inside grows sharper and larger. Euphoria flows through you, connecting your sense to the ever-growing sensation of raw energy flowing through your body.

 

 “Now,” Christina says. “Open your eyes, and concentrate on Britney.”

 

 "Me again?" you hear Britney pipe up. "No fair!" It takes everything to not lose concentration as she’s shushed by the rest of the group.

 

 “Repeat these words”, you hear Christina say after a few moments. “*Fall asleep, and let your memories drift as you slumber.*”

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 You repeat the words that Christina told you, staring at Britney and her dejected face.

 

 Energy flashes out from you like a lance, striking Britney’s body. Her eyes grow into saucers before she collapses to the mat on her side.
 
 

 Stacey leaps up and rushes over to check on Britney. Christina looks at you, smiling with satisfaction. You note that even Reagan is watching you intently.

 

 After some moments, Stacey manages to bring Britney around. “Ow,” she winces. “My head.”

 

 Stacey helps her friend sit up. Britney looks around. When her eyes fall on you, she frowns.

 

 “Oh! Hey! Did Chrissie induct you into the squad yet? My brain is like a sieve. With holes. Large ones.”

 

 Christina glances back at you, still smiling. “Now that was quite impressive, Emily. You continue to impress me. That doesn’t happen often. Welcome to the coven.”

 

 Britney claps. Stacey gives you a smile. Even Reagan nods. Slightly.

 

 “There is one last thing,” Christina continues. “A final test. Based on what you just did, I’m sure it will be of no trouble to you.”

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 “What’s the final test?” you ask Christina.

 

 The head cheerleader purses her lips. “Does the name Liz Pleasant mean anything to you?”

 

 You try to hide your alarm. “She’s in my maths class. I think.”

 

 Christina brushes a strand of her blonde hair behind her ear and grimly smiles. “Perfect. She has been looking into things that she shouldn’t be looking into.”

 

 You wince, as Christina waits for a response. “Magic, you mean?”

 

 “Precisely. I don’t know how or where, but she knows more than is acceptable.” Christina glances in the direction of Stacey and Britney. “Perhaps some people have been talking about things in places where they shouldn’t?”

 

 Stacey and Britney both look down at their respective mats, averting their gazes.

 

 “I need her to forget anything she ever learned about magic,” Christina tells you. “Now that you know that spell, it should be simple for you. If she’s in your maths class, invite her over to study together. That should give you the privacy you need.”

 

 You look at Christina, then nod. She smiles, again with a cold edge to the mannerism.

 

 “I think that concludes this evening.” Christina turns to the rest of the group. “That will do for this evening.”

 

 The other cheerleaders nod and begin to put their mats away. As you stand up, Christina moves over to you.

 

 “When you’ve dealt with Liz, come back in the evening. I’ve got a lot to teach you.”

 

 **Actions**

 <>

Ask her to give you time to consider it
Cast Sleep and Forget on Britney

title: SchoolGymCheerleaderWards0
text:
"I've made sure that Liz won't be a problem," you tell them. “She doesn’t remember a thing.”

 

 The cheerleaders whisper mutters of approval between them. Christina smiles, giving Reagan a look. True to form, she scowls.

 

 “Then I formally greet you as a cheerleader for Charlton school,” Christina says, glancing at Reagan. “Unless there are no objections.”

 

 Reagan says nothing. The others all burst out in cheers. 

 

 “You can now take your uniform,” Christina tells you. “Wear it for school if you like, to make sure that everyone knows you’re now one of us. And take advantage of the special perks of being a cheerleader. If you have things to do outside of school in the afternoon, you’ll find the teachers won’t stop you leaving. Mr. Stitch gives his exceptional students special privileges, which includes our squad. And your grades won’t suffer, either.”

 

 “You should come with us to the pool at the Country Club one afternoon, Em!” Britney says excitedly. “There’s a lot of hot boys to watch!”

 

 Christina gives you a look, but her smile is light and warm. “I personally spend a lot of my time at my father’s store. If you want to indulge in a little window shopping, drop by one afternoon. Or, if you aren't quite brave enough to leave school during the day, I'll be there Saturday and Sunday mornings too.”

 

 “Has he got new stock yet, Chrissie?” Stacey asks.

 

 “Not anything that would fit your lanky body,” Britney sniggers.

 

 With the patience of a mother hen, Christina waits for their bickering to stop. She then turns back to you. “Now. On to our duties. The curses. Or, to use the magical name. Let’s talk about Wards.”

 <>
 

 **Actions**

 <>

 “Now listen carefully, Emily,” Christina begins. “This is very important. If you don’t understand or something isn’t clear, please let me know. I want you to get this right.”

 

 “Wards are what we call the magic we practise at Charlton. They are spells cast on everyday things, designed to guide and shape our friends and fellow students. With a little nudge here and there, everyone becomes the best versions of themselves. It’s almost gratifying to watch, like a caterpillar turning into a butterfly.”

 

 “We maintain these spells in the kitchen, the Maths room, Geography Room, Business Studies, Biology class, and of course, in this gymnasium. Now that you’ve been awakened to your magical affinity, you should be able to sense them. 

 

 “Your job will be to review them regularly, and ensure none of them has been tampered with. With the likes of Elizabeth prowling around, I wouldn’t be surprised to find that some have been compromised.”

 

 You glance around the room, noticing that the other cheerleaders are listening aptly to their leader. “How do you get into some of those places?”

 

 “Good question,” Christina says, smirking. “Unfortunately we have to be discreet. There are some teachers at Charlton who aren’t privy to our activities. You’ll have to use your wits, I’m afraid. Although, we can help out where we can.”

 

 She turns to Stacey and Britney, giving them an arched eyebrow. “Have you still got the key to the kitchen?”

 

 
 
 The pair look at each other, sheepishly. They both lower their eyes to the floor. 

 

 “Britney lost it,” Stacey mutters.

 

 “I did not! You didn’t give it to me!”

 

 Christina sighs, grimacing. The facade of her composed demeanour slips just for a moment. “Clutzes! The both of you.”

 

 She turns back to you, a forced smile reappearing. “Like I said, you’ll need to show some initiative. Lord knows someone has to.”
 
 
 The pair look at each other, accusingly. Then Britney seems to remember. “Oh yes! I have it!” She scrambles around for her school bag and pulls out the kitchen key, handing it to you.
 
 
 

 “How do I modify the curses?” you ask Christina, before quickly adding: “If something’s been changed.”

 

 “Simple,” she replies. “It’s time for your next lesson. I’m going to teach you how to perform Ward.”

 

 Actions

 
 
 <>
 
 
 
 
 
 <>
 
 
 
 
 

 
 Not wishing to show your hand, you indulge Christina’s attempts to train you, in spite of already knowing the spell she’s about to teach.

 Once again, you sit cross-legged on the mat. Christina tells you to focus on the power within you. “Feel it prickling inside your body.”

 

 You close your eyes, sensing the magical energies swelling inside of you. You feel its power, ready to obey your command.

 

 “Reach out,” you hear Christina say. “Look for that feeling outside your body. In Stacey. In Britney. In Reagan. In me.”

 

 You sense the power in all of them. Britney’s power is meagre, Stacey is not far ahead of her. Reagan feels prickly and spiky, with a surge of raw magic ricocheting inside her. Christina is the most powerful of the lot. Perhaps even more than you.

 

 “Turn your attention to the gym,” Christina’s voice tells you. “The ropes. Benches. Monkey bars.”

 

 Your mind’s eye wanders across the gym, sensing the magic infused within the gym equipment. Like lights in a dark room, they all stand out to you.

 

 “Excellent,” Christina purrs. “Pick one. Focus on it.”

 

 You zero in on one of the yoga balls, recalling your first trip to the gym. It radiates power. You feel its heat within it. 

 

 “Repeat after me,” Christina says. “I curse this object with power beyond its power. Unseen and unheard, its effects will be felt by all except us.”

 

 You brace yourself, ready to say the words.

 

 Actions

 <> 
 
 
 

 You repeat Christina’s words. You feel the energies within the ball crack and splitter. 

 

 “Push!” Christina tells you.

 

 Like a window shattering, the magic within the ball erupts into a thousand fragments. They hang in the air, flickering like fairy lights, floating and unmoving. 

 

 “Now,” Christina instructs you. “Force them together.”

 

 With a gentle thought, you find you can direct the embers to move. If you shattered the glass before, your mind now sweeps the fragments up together. As they meet each other, they bond and reform.

 

 You push them towards the yoga ball and they seep into it, sticking to it like treacle. Within moments, the ball shines to you as brightly as before, the Ward restored.

 

 Satisfied, you open your eyes. Christina is smiling proudly back at you.

 

 “See,” she comments. “Simple. You should find that it’s easier to sense what is magic and what is not now.”

 

 You look around the gym, noticing the magical embers flowing off almost every piece of equipment. “It’s one of our more complex works,” you hear Christina say.

 

 You blink yourself, refocusing on reality. The other cheerleaders look at you with admiration. Except Reagan. But instead of scowling, she has now taken to just watching you.

 

 “That should be enough for now,” Christina says. “Go take a look at the other Wards around the school. Let me know if you find anything irregular. And don’t forget - department store. Afternoons.”

 

 You nod, taking the hint that the meeting is over. The other girls begin to drag their mats to the side of the gym. Christina gives you a friendly smile, and you walk out the door.

 

 Actions

 <>

choices.label: Listen to Christina tell you about Wards
Cast Ward on the Yoga Ball

title: PEClassWatch
text:
You hand over the note that you penned to Coach Beach. He snatches it up, unfolds it, and reads it carefully. Once he’s done, his eyes look up over the note at you, eyeing you.

 

 “Cramps, eh?” He sighs. “A poor excuse to duck out of some exercise, but I’ve been told that I need to make allowances for your ladies."

 

 Behind you, one of the kids in uniform sniggers. He falls silent quickly when Beach gives him a dark look.

 

 “Alright, Phillips. You’ve got a pass. Get over in the sin bin. The rest of you, let’s see if your notes are as convincing.”

 

 You stand up from the bench and move up to the top seat on the rafters in the corner. A few other students join you after Beach verifies their own notes. You smile politely, but they make no efforts to respond. Only Chester, a kid with glazed eyes, meets your stare as Beach reluctantly lets him sit out.

 

 Actions

 <>

 
 
 Beach walks over to the centre of the gym. “Alright kids,” he bellows. “Weatherman says it’s going to drizzle today. And whilst I think you all can survive a bit of rain, I’ve been told that some of you have weak immune systems. I don’t need your moms on the phone yelling at me for getting you sick.”

 

 You notice Beach looks up to the bleachers. For a moment, you think he’s looking at you. But his eyes drift to Chester beside you. The boy gazes vacantly down into the floor, unaware he’s being watched.

 

 “So same old, same old,” Beach says, returning his attention to the class. “Inside activities. Boys with boys. Girls with girls. Pair off into fives and go stand by one of the obstacles on the course. Only rule - don’t come last.”

 

 The students organise themselves into groups - either groups of girls, or groups of boys. As they do so, from the side of your eye you catch Chester staring at you.

 

 “Your hair is shining,” he tells you. “It’s glowing yellow.”

 

 The shriek of Beach’s whistle snaps your gaze back to the gym, as the squeaking and sliding of fifty pairs of sneakers fills the air.

 
 “Alright, settle down!" Beach bellows from the centre of the room. He gestures to the drizzle hitting the full length windows and tells the class that they’ll be inside again today.

 

 “Hop to it, then,” he says. “Get in your groups and try to conjure up at least a little enthusiasm. Loser still gets the booby prize.”

 

 Next to you, Chester stretches, then stares up, enraptured by the hanging halogen lamps. “It wriggles.”

 
 

 **Actions**

 <>

 
 
 The students throw themselves around the gym with enthusiasm, leaping through exercise after exercise. The smell of sweat soon fills the air.

 

 “It’s hot,” you hear Chester say to another student sitting out. His words are soft and slow. “Like a dry heat.”

 

 "What are you talking about, Chester?" the kid replies. “It’s freezing in here.”

 

 Chester breaks into a sloppy slide, looking back to the gym. “Never freezes in the jungle,” he mutters.

 

 Out on the gym floor, the class continues. You see the students perspiring from the activity. Sweat patches are forming on polo shirts. Hair turns wet and slick. 

 

 The groups of boys watch the girls exercise in-between activities. Some of the bolder ones whoop and cheer, casting lecherous looks towards the girls.

 

 
 However, the response seems to surprise them. Instead of encouraging it, the girls scowl and roll their eyes. One even calls them out. “Keep your eyes off me, you perv.”

 

 The knockbacks appear to put the boys on the back foot. Uncharacteristically for Charlton, they seem unsure of themselves. They begin to fumble and trip as they exercise. By the end of the lesson, the only cheers and hollers are coming from the women, applauding each other's efforts.

 

 
 The girls appear to respond to it. A number of them throw coy smiles back at the comments. Stretches that spread legs and arch backs are held longer than is needed. A number of flips and jumps purposefully are made to flash a glimpse of underwear to the audience. As if they are performing to the crowd.

 

 You take a breath, smelling the body odour lingering in the gym. Fortunately, your mind is clear. Nothing about the increasing catcalls and whistles has any impact on you.

 

 The girls increasingly respond to them as they perform more exercises. You watch them pant and gasp for air, as they put more effort into their movements and exercise. Only those who are struggling with physical activity seem to be ignoring the crowd.

 

 
 As the girls flip and leap through the activities, they appear to respond enthusiastically to the boys' commentary. The more athletic they are, the more they seem to be performing to the crowd. A vicious circle, the boys in turn give them more attention.

 

 
 Free from worrying about exercise, you focus your inner powers and concentrate on the gym. You see the room through your mind’s eye, trying to sense what is causing their behaviour.

 

 The idle chatter from the excluded students constantly threatens to distract you, but you can see whispers of magic flowing from the gym equipment, drifting into the bodies of the students as they breathe heavily.

 

 It’s the equipment, you think. It’s giving off some sort of magical energy that the students are breathing in.

 

 
 You can't be certain what's causing it, but you are certain it's unnatural. You note that in spite of being in the gym, whatever magic at play here has no effect on you.

 
 
 
 The students enthusiastically start exercising, moving from one activity to the next. Sweat fills the air. Students begin to perspire and take deep breaths from the activity.

 

 The male students focus their attention on the girls in-between their own exercising. Sounds of whoops and cheers accompany grins and leering looks.

 

 
 The response is muted. Girls scowl and roll their eyes. “You’re a runt,” one girl calls out as a boy watches her bend over to stretch. The change in tone unnerves the boys. Some of them start to make mistakes and stumble. By the end, they finish in silence.

 

 
 The girls respond, welcomingly. They throw coy smiles back and linger on stretches that call attention to their bodies. They grin as they are applauded, playing to the audience. For them, the curse is still very much a reality.

 

 
 The girls increasingly respond to them as they perform more exercises. You watch them pant and gasp for air, as they put more effort into their movements and exercise. Only those who are struggling with physical activity seem to be ignoring the crowd.

 
 Focusing on the magic in the air around you, you think you know why. You see the room through your mind’s eye, trying to sense what is causing their behaviour.

 

 The idle chatter from the excluded students constantly threatens to distract you, but you can see whispers of magic flowing from the gym equipment, drifting into the bodies of the students as they breathe heavily.

 

 It’s the equipment, you think. It’s giving off some sort of magical energy that the students are breathing in.

 

 
 It dawns on you that you too feel nothing other than mild annoyance towards the guys. Something is at play here, something you just can't quite see. But you are certain it has to be magical.

 

 
 
 
 Actions

 <>
 
 
 
 

 
 
 Beach blows his whistle for a final time and the students take a seat on the respective sides of the gym. Girls on one side. Boys on the other.

 

 “Good efforts, good efforts,” Beach says from the centre of the gym. “At least from some of you. But we all know what happens to those who don’t perform. Don’t we, boys?”

 

 There is a surprising lack of enthusiasm from the male side of the gymnasium. After struggling with the activities today, the boys seem unsure of themselves. 

 He glances back at the boys' side of the gym. They whoop and holler at his beckon. They seem confident that none of them will end up last.

 

 “So,” Beach says, turning back to your side of the room. “Who’s today’s recipient of my favourite booby prize? Who is spending tonight cleaning up the sweat from my precious gym floor?" His eyes roam across the girls' faces.

 

 "Miss Oats," Beach cries out. "Congratulations!"

 

 
 There is a smattering of applause from the boys' side, but you see the signs of relief in some of the faces. The girls, by contrast, are muttering amongst themselves, each peppered with frowns and confusion. Objectively, some of the boys did worse today.

 

 Beach seems unnerved by the response. “Get to the showers, then,” he mutters. “Dismissed.”

 

 Everyone begins to rush out, ready to shower and go home. You glance at Heather, sitting alone on the bench, shocked.

 
 He glances back at the boys' side of the gym. They whoop and holler at his beckon. They seem confident that none of them will end up last.

 

 The gym teacher turns back to the class. “Get to the showers. Show’s over!”

 

 Everyone begins to rush out, ready to shower and go home. You glance at Heather as you walk by, but she stares down into the dirty floor.

title: PEClass
text:
“Alright kids,” you hear Beach bellow. Like everyone else, you turn to look at him in the centre of the gym, as if it was a stage. “Weatherman says it’s going to drizzle today. And whilst I think you all can survive a bit of rain, I’ve been told that some of you have weak immune systems. I don’t need your moms on the phone yelling at me for getting you sick.”

 

 “So same old, same old. Inside activities. Boys with boys. Girls with girls. Pair off into fives and go stand by one of the obstacles on the course. Only rule - don’t come last.”

 

 You turn around and are accepted into a group forming nearby. Other students aren’t so lucky, but within a minute everyone is separated into squads. The organiser of your group gestures for you to move over to the balance beam. Like everything in here, it smells like a gym sock. Removing the curse hasn't stopped the smell from threatening to overpower you.

 

 Beach’s whistle shrieks and instantly the sounds of fifty sneakers squeaking and sliding fills the air. You clamber up on to equipment, energised by the noise, and move as fast as you can over the beam. It’s enough to remind you that this body is still new to you, with your centre of gravity shifted away from what you are used to.

 

 “Careful, Phillips,” you hear Beach say as he passes by. “You won’t find a knight in shining armour to catch you in here.”

 

 Ignoring him, you make it to the other side. The other girls follow suit and quickly you’re moving around to the next course. So quick, in fact, that the group of boys in front of you hasn’t finished on the vaulting boxes.

 

 You take deep breaths as you feel your heart beating. The natural endorphins from exercise start to circulate through your body. There is something rewarding about the class, especially as you are free of any adverse effects from the equipment. The body odour of teenage boys' is still repellant, but you find some degree of enjoyment in the activity.

 

 The last boy in the group in front of you vaults over the box and looks back at you, indicating you’re free to go.
 
 
 “Alright, settle down!” Beach bellows from the centre of the room. He gestures to the drizzle hitting the exterior of the full length windows and tells the group with some disappointment that you’ll again be spending the lesson inside today. 

 

 “Hop to it, then,” he tells the class. “Get in your groups and try to conjure up at least a little enthusiasm. Loser still gets the booby prize.”

 

 You stand and form your regular group, moving over to the Balance Beam that permeates with dust and sweat. Coach Beach blows his whistle and you clamber up one end of the beam, running across it with a sense of confidence that you’ve done this before.

 

 The rest of your group does the same and quickly you’re waiting for the group in front of you to finish using the Vaulting Box. Blood pumps through your veins and you feel invigorated by the rush of exercise. With the curse no longer in effect, the offensiveness of stale body odour is only more present to your senses. 

 

 The last boy in the group in front finishes, nodding that you are free to go.
 
 
 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>

 
 <> 
 
 
 
 “Alright kids,” you hear Beach bellow. Like everyone else, you turn to look at him in the centre of the gym, as if it was a stage. “Weatherman says it’s going to drizzle today. And whilst I think you all can survive a bit of rain, I’ve been told that some of you have weak immune systems. I don’t need your moms on the phone yelling at me for getting you sick.”

 

 “So same old, same old. Inside activities. Boys with boys. Girls with girls. Pair off into fives and go stand by one of the obstacles on the course. Only rule - don’t come last.”

 

 You turn around and are accepted into a group forming nearby. Other students aren’t so lucky, but within a minute everyone is separated into squads. The organiser of your group gestures for you to move over to the balance beam. Like everything in here, it smells like a gym sock. You find it almost overwhelming. 

 

 Beach’s whistle shrieks and instantly the sounds of fifty sneakers squeaking and sliding fills the air. You clamber up on to equipment, energised by the noise, and move as fast as you can over the beam. It’s enough to remind you that this body is still new to you, with your centre of gravity shifted away from what you are used to.

 

 “Careful, Phillips,” you hear Beach say as he passes by. “You won’t find a knight in shining armour to catch you in here.”

 

 Ignoring him, you make it to the other side. The other girls follow suit and quickly you’re moving around to the next course. So quick, in fact, that the group of boys in front of you hasn’t finished on the vaulting boxes.

 

 You take deep breaths as you feel your heart beating. The natural endorphins from exercise are starting to work their magic. You admit to yourself that there is something rewarding about this class, especially with Emily’s superior physique. Even the body odour from some of the teenage boys isn’t as offensive as it seemed moments ago.

 

 The last boy in the group in front of you vaults over the box and looks back at you, indicating you’re free to go.
 
 
 “Alright, settle down!” Beach bellows from the centre of the room. He gestures to the drizzle hitting the exterior of the full length windows and tells the group with some disappointment that you’ll again be spending the lesson inside today. 

 

 “Hop to it, then,” he tells the class. “Get in your groups and try to conjure up at least a little enthusiasm. Loser still gets the booby prize.”

 

 You stand and form your regular group, moving over to the Balance Beam that permeates with dust and sweat. Coach Beach blows his whistle and you clamber up one end of the beam, running across it with a sense of confidence that you’ve done this before.

 

 The rest of your group does the same and quickly you’re waiting for the group in front of you to finish using the Vaulting Box. Blood pumps through your veins and you feel invigorated by the rush of exercise. The offensiveness of stale body odour seems to diminish. Growing oddly comforting, even.

 

 The last boy in the group in front finishes, nodding that you are free to go.
 
 
 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>

 
 <> 
 

 
 
 
 You grin and rush forward towards the vaulting box. Your nimble body and quick feet move quickly and suddenly you’re instinctively throwing your hands on top of the box.

 

 The world flips on its axis as you turn upside down. Legs are above your body, back kicking them high vertically into the air. 

 

 With a gentle thud, you feel your feet touch down on a mat. It takes a second for you to get your bearings. You are standing on the other side of the vault box, feet firmly on the floor. 

 

 As you regain your breath, there is some gentle applause from nearby students. Even Coach Beach is looking at you from beside the mat, a hint of surprise on his face.

 

 “Nice work, Phillips,” he murmurs. “Make a cheerleader out of you, yet. Might want to adjust yourself back there, though.”

 

 You follow his eyeline and glance over your shoulder down your back. Gravity has had its way with your skirt. The back is now bunched up around your waist, showing your gym briefs to the rows of onlooking boys behind you.

 

 Upon seeing you notice, they burst out laughing. You even get a few wolf whistles.

 

 You take a deep breath, panting from the exertion. The smell of cheap boys' deodorant fills your nostrils. It serves as a reminder of the curse you've removed, which would have made you smile at the attention.

 

 Instead, you brush down your skirt and throw them a dark look. As you regain your breath, you take solace that whilst you may feel on display, you no longer have magic making you indulge it.
 
 
 You rush forward and clear the distance between you and the box, then push your hands forward and throw yourself up into the air. The thrill of your agility flutters inside your body as you turn upside down, your nimble legs thrust up high in the air. 

 

 You land with a gentle thud on the other side, hearing a few whoops and whistles from behind you. Coach Beach even gives you an appreciative grin.

 

 You look back at him, not returning his smile. Instead, you check your clothing to make sure it's all in the right place. The attention soon diverts elsewhere and, free from the curse in the gym, you are all the more glad for it.

 With a gentle thud, you feel your feet touch down on a mat. It takes a second for you to get your bearings. You are standing on the other side of the vault box, arms stretched out, smiling broadly, feet firmly on the floor. 

 

 As you regain your breath, there is some gentle applause from nearby students. Even Coach Beach is looking at you from beside the mat, a hint of surprise on his face.

 

 “Nice work, Phillips,” he murmurs. “Make a cheerleader out of you, yet. Might want to adjust yourself back there, though.”

 You take a deep breath, panting from the exertion. The smell of cheap boys' deodorant fills your nostrils. You have to admit, there’s something pleasant about it.

 

 Looking, to the crowd. You give them a coy smile. “Oops,” you say to them.

 

 It’s enough for them to start laughing again. You watch them over your shoulder, lips open, as you pose there in your exposed underwear. Predatory smiles play out on their faces looking at you. 

 

 You bite your lip and give them a final look, then brush your skirt down. Finally getting your breath from the exercise, you know you have every eye on the gym on you.

 

 At least the ones belonging to the boys, anyway.
 
 
 You rush forward and clear the distance between you and the box, then push your hands forward and throw yourself up into the air. The thrill of your agility flutters inside your body as you turn upside down, your nimble legs thrust up high in the air. 

 

 You land with a gentle thud on the other side, stretching your hands out and smiling, as you gasp for air. You smile as you hear whoops and whistles from the boys behind you. Even Coach Beach flashes you an appreciative grin. 

 

 You look back over your shoulder at your audience and reach down without breaking eye contact, checking your skirt. It has only ridden up slightly, but you make it a big deal, even pulling it up a bit more momentarily to adjust it.

 

 A brief flash is enough to get another round of applause out of them. You give them all a grin, taking deep breaths, basking in the attention they are giving you.

 
 
 

 Actions

 You run forward towards the vaulting box. Your light body can move quickly and almost too soon you’re right in front of the box. Instinctively you stretch your hands out and push them down against the top of the box.

 

 You feel your body lift off the floor, arching on to its side as the world spins and your legs sweep up over the equipment. 

 

 A moment later you land, feeling your sneakers touch down on the soft gym mat on the other side of the vaulting box. 

 

 You take a deep breath, both through exertion and relief that you cleared the box. The next girl in your group smiles back at you encouragingly as she readies her own attempt.

 

 “Move, Phillips,” you hear Beach tell you from nearby. “There’s no applause coming, and you’re holding up the line.”

 

 You look at him and nod, moving to the side of the gym mat. The other girls in your group repeat the exercise, joining you once they too have vaulted. 

 

 You take the time to regain your breath, panting a little from the activity. Without the curse active, you make no attempt to stifle your breathing. You smell the cheap deodorant hanging in the air. 

 

 A boy walks by, flashing you a smile. You can't help but wince as his body odour hits your nostrils. 

 

 Looking dejected, he turns away and walks on.

 
 You run forward and instinctively stretch your hands out when you reach the box, lifting your body off the floor. You pivot your body on its side, pulling your legs up and over, landing cleanly on the other side of the equipment. 

 

 Taking a deep breath, you feel energised at a successful vault. You give a grin back to your group as the next girl braces herself to follow and move to the side of the mat. 

 

 You watch the rest of your group repeat your performance, smelling the stench of nearby boys as you regain your breath. The group in front strain their muscles as they exercise. Without the curse, the only effect of smells and sights are to offend your sense of smell.

 Your attention drifts away to look at the boys performing the exercises in front of your group. Pulling themselves across monkey bars, flexing their muscles, faces covered in perspiration. You find it curious. You’ve never really noticed how defined a boys' arms can be, before.

 

 When one even walks by you, you take in his body scent as he passes by. He looks at you, eyes flicking up and down your body. He grins. 

 

 Without meaning to, you grin back. Was he checking you out?

You look over at the group in-front, watching the boys flex their muscles with curiosity. You can’t help but smile back as a few of them return your gaze. Only then do you realise that you are indeed actually gazing.

 With little enthusiasm, you jog over to the vaulting box. You put your hands on top of it, and slowly pull yourself up. Sitting on the top of the box, you swing your legs over, still keeping them together, and drop on to the other side.

 

 You catch Beach looking at you as you walk casually across the mats. “You okay, Phillips? Maybe take it even easier. We wouldn’t want you breaking a nail.”

 

 You hold yourself back from responding. There are sniggers behind you from the group in front of yours. The boys give you derisive looks.

 You watch the group of boys in front of you perform the exercise. A number of them slip, losing their grip. You can see the sweat glisten on the bars from here.

 You take a deep breath, readying yourself, thinking about the boys. You briefly find yourself wondering what that sweat smells like…

 

 As you rest, you look around the gym at the other students. The boys waiting to start an exercise watch the girls stretch and leap with lustful glee. A few of them call out and whistle as they perform.

 

 The more athletic girls appear to respond warmly to the catcalls, posing after they complete exercises and grinning between pants. You find yourself pouting.

 

 Are you envious of the attention they are getting?

 

 You prepare for the next exercise.

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>

 
 <>
 

 
 
 
 Once the last boy drops down at the other side, you sprint over to the equipment and throw yourself up onto the bar. The rigorous activity acts as a deterrent to thinking, almost like an exorcism of the mental cobwebs creeping over your brain. 

 

 You reach out rung by rung, swinging your legs high in the air. You push yourself to the limit, feeling better. Fitter. Stronger.

 

 The sweat on the bars isn't pleasant, but you are free from the grasp of magic in the gym. You sense nothing from the equipment, nor mats, nor ropes and exercise gear.

 

 You see Coach Beach staring at you, a curious look on his face. Burying the thoughts, you focus on putting in as much energy as you can.

 

 Once you've completed the monkey bars, you move to the next set of equipment. And then the next. Pushing yourself to the limit. A number of students applaud your efforts. A few of them whistle and cheer.

 

 You ignore the stare and lustful grins though. By the end of the lesson, though exhausted, you are content with what you managed to achieve.

 
 

 Dismissing any lingering thoughts, you sprint over to the monkey bars when the last boy in the group ahead completes his task. You move across the rungs, pushing yourself as fast as you can.
 
 

 Out of the corner of your eye you notice the boys watching, but without the enticing magic you keep your mind focused on the lesson. In a flash you slink across the bars and drop down at the far side.

 

 Moving on, you continue to push your body. On occasion you notice that your enthusiasm comes close to causing a wardrobe accident, but you don't care. The boys may be watching you, but their stares are barely a second thought.

 You reach out rung by rung, swinging your legs high in the air. You push yourself to the limit, feeling better. Fitter. Stronger.

 

 And you know the boys keep watching your athletic body bend and stretch as you throw yourself around.

 

 You look over to the group in front, watching you as your legs swing wide and free. You grin, dropping down after swinging from the last bar.

 

 Inside your brain, however, a voice of panic is crying out. As you rest for a second, as you breathe deeply, smelling the alluring scents of boys' perspiration and body odour. Then you see it. Magical embers flowing from the gym equipment, drifting into your body as you breathe. It’s not just one thing in the gym that’s cursed, you think. It’s everything.

 Why am I thinking like this, you hear inside your mind. You take in another quick gasp of air, smelling the intoxicating smells of boys' deodorant and sweat. Then it registers. You can almost see the magical embers radiating out from the gym equipment, drifting into your nostrils as you breathe. Whatever is causing you to feel like this, you’re sure that’s part of it.

 Something doesn’t sit right with you, but the thought always seems just out of reach. You are certain there's magic at play though. There has to be.

 
 

 You see Coach Beach staring and you bury your thoughts back down in your mind. Instead, you keep putting in as much energy as you can, despite the underlying worry inside your brain. 

 

 Moving on to the next set of equipment, you continue pushing your body to its limit, seemingly throwing caution to the wind as you let your skirt ride up and your polo shirt to drop down. Yet some part of you enjoys it. Especially the eyes that increasingly move from what they are doing, and focus on you.

 

 By the end, you are receiving cheers and whistles every time you perform. And what a performance you make it. You grin with delight as you notice guys watching. More foreign to you, in-between exercises you’re drawn to watch them too.

 
 Dismissing any lingering thoughts, you sprint over to the monkey bars when the last boy in the group ahead completes his task. You move across the rungs, pushing yourself as fast as you can.

 

 You flash a grin to the boys, watching you. You feel a thrill as you move, feeling their eyes lingering on your body as you twist and slink across the bars and drop down at the end. You briefly wonder what they’re thinking…

 

 Inside your brain, however, a voice of panic is crying out. As you rest for a second, as you breathe deeply, smelling the alluring scents of boys' perspiration and body odour. Then you see it. Magical embers flowing from the gym equipment, drifting into your body as you breathe. It’s not just one thing in the gym that’s cursed, you think. It’s everything.

 Why am I thinking like this, you hear inside your mind. You take in another quick gasp of air, smelling the intoxicating smells of boys' deodorant and sweat. Then it registers. You can almost see the magical embers radiating out from the gym equipment, drifting into your nostrils as you breathe. Whatever is causing you to feel like this, you’re sure that’s part of it.

 Something doesn’t sit right with you, but the thought always seems just out of reach. You are certain there's magic at play though. There has to be.

 
 

 Moving on to the next exercise, you continue to push your body, uncaring of how much your rigorous energy is flaunting your body. Some part of you enjoys being on display. Having the attention and admiration of the class. The boys regularly stop to watch you. And in-between exercises, you watch them too.

 
 
 

 Actions

 <>
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 You step up to the monkey bars as the last boy swings down from the last rung. He glances back at you. You smile back, politely.

 

 Then it’s your turn. You reach up and pull yourself off the floor. You feel your skirt threatening to ride up as your legs rise, so you’re careful not to overexert yourself as you move across the equipment. As you feel your arms straining, you gasp for precious oxygen to power your body, smelling the odour of the boy that came before.

 

 You try not to look, but you can feel eyes watching you. For a brief moment you catch the sight of one of the boys from the group in front, staring at your parted legs as you swing from bar to bar.

 

 He’s trying to catch a glimpse of my briefs, you think. You shoot him a dirty stare and he quickly looks to the floor, embarrassed.

 

 You ponder for a brief moment that thanks to the curses the boys may have grown used to the girls liking the attention. 

 

 Dropping down from the last bar, you grin thinly. Your mind is clear. You can focus on the lesson. And not on the boys. 

 

 You see Coach Beach staring and you dismiss the thoughts to avoid drawing more attention to yourself. Instead, you focus on getting through the lesson. When your group moves on to the next one, you try not to exert yourself anymore than is necessary to finish.

 

 By the end, you’ve done enough that you feel you have at least projected the image of hard-work and enthusiasm. You finish short-of-breath, breathing heavily in spite of the scent of sweaty teenagers. 

 

 Looking around, you see the boy from earlier looking at you. When you catch his eyeline, he looks away again, blushing.

 
 

 The last boy in front swings down from the bars and looks back at you to signal you can begin. You ignore him and swing forward, grabbing the first bar.

 

 Your arms strain as you move across the bars and you gasp for oxygen to help, trying to avoid taking a whiff of the sweat on the equipment. You glance forward and see the boy watching you, staring at your legs swinging in the air.

 

 Free from the curses, your mind is clear. Focusing on getting through the exercise, you complete the activity. When your group moves on, you do enough to complete the lesson.

 

 By the end, you feel you have put in enough effort to at least pass. You finish short-of-breath, happy to be free to breath easily and without concern.

 

 
 
 
 
 You step up to the monkey bars as the last boy swings down from the last rung. He glances back at you. You smile.

 

 Then it’s your turn. You reach up and pull yourself off the floor. You feel your skirt threatening to ride up as your legs rise, so you’re careful not to overexert yourself as you move across the equipment. As you feel your arms straining, you gasp for precious oxygen to power your body, smelling the scent of the boy that came before.

 

 You try not to look, but you can feel eyes watching you. For a brief moment you catch the sight of one of the boys from the group in front, staring at your parted legs as you swing from bar to bar.

 

 He’s trying to catch a glimpse of my briefs, you think. Maybe you should just stretch a bit more…

 

 
 The thought is enough to set alarm bells ringing inside your brain. Still trying to maintain grip on the bars that are slippery with sweat, you gasp for air.

 

 Then you see it. Magical embers flow off the gym equipment, drifting into your body as you breathe. You look around the gym and see a similar sight for every activity. It’s not just one thing in the gym that’s cursed, you think. It’s everything.
 
 
 Why am I thinking like this, you hear inside your mind. You take in another quick gasp of air, as you try not to slip on the next bar that is covered in sweet sweat.

 

 Then it registers. You can almost see the magic radiating out from the equipment, drifting up your nostrils as you breathe. Whatever is causing you to feel like this, you’re sure that’s part of it.

 
 You instantly feel off, as the thought echoes in your mind. Something is very wrong about this, you know, but whatever it is feels just out of grasp. Like a monkey bar always just out of reach. Enough of your mind is still yours though to know it has something to do with magic. Because this isn't you.

 

 *Isn't it?*

 
 

 You see Coach Beach staring and you dismiss the thoughts to avoid drawing more attention to yourself. Instead, you focus on getting through the exercise. When your group moves on to the next one, you try not to exert yourself anymore than is necessary to finish the lesson.

 

 By the end, you’ve done enough that you feel you have at least projected the image of hard-work and enthusiasm. You finish short-of-breath, inhaling the scent of sweaty teenagers and cheap spray that tries to mask poor hygiene from some of the boys.

 

 It’s not so bad, a thought says to you at the back of your brain. Almost attractive.

 

 Just as you hear the thought, you see the boy from the group in front of yours looking back at you. He gives you a wink. With inner turmoil, you find yourself smiling back.

 

 
 The last boy in front swings down from the bars and looks back at you to signal you can begin. You flash him a smile and swing forward, grabbing the first bar.

 

 Your arms strain as you move across the bars and you gasp for oxygen to help, smelling the scent of the boy. You glance forward and see him watching, staring at your legs swinging in the air. It's kind of a compliment…

 

 
 The thought is enough to set alarm bells ringing inside your brain. Still trying to maintain grip on the bars that are slippery with sweat, you gasp for air. 

 

 Then you see it. Magical embers flow off the gym equipment, drifting into your body as you breathe. You look around the gym and see a similar sight for every activity. It’s not just one thing in the gym that’s cursed, you think. It’s everything.

 

 
 Why am I thinking like this, you hear inside your mind. You take in another quick gasp of air, as you try not to slip on the next bar that is covered in sweet sweat.

 

 Then it registers. You can almost see the magic radiating out from the equipment, drifting up your nostrils as you breathe. Whatever is causing you to feel like this, you’re sure that’s part of it.
 
 
 You instantly feel off, as the thought echoes in your mind. Something is very wrong about this, you know, but whatever it is feels just out of grasp. Like a monkey bar always just out of reach. Whatever it is, you believe it's magic. You hope.
 
 
 

 Focusing on getting through the exercise, you complete the activity. When your group moves on, you try only to do enough to complete the lesson.

 

 By the end, you feel you have put in enough effort to at least pass. You finish short-of-breath, inhaling the scent of sweaty teenagers. One of them from the group in front of you catches your eye, giving you a wink. You find yourself smiling back.
 
 
 
 

 Actions

 <>
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 Once the boys in front of you are done, you amble over to the monkey bars. From close-up, you can see the perspiration coating each rung. Yuck!

 

 Tentatively, you reach up and wrap your fingers around it. It’s sticky and smelly. You try not to wretch as you push off the starting block.

 

 The effort to move from one bar to the next is deceptively high, especially when you’re trying to avoid touching them. You inelegantly clasp towards the next one, wobbling with only one hand holding you up.

 

 “Watch out, boys,” you hear Beach holler. “Timber!”

 

 For a moment you think you’ve gotten hold of the rung, but as you swing forward your grip gives way and you tumble to the floor.

 

 You land with a soft thud against the rank gym mat. It feels moist to touch. As you hit it, a number of dust particles blow up. You can smell years of dry teenage sweat exploding like a mushroom cloud.

 

 “Might want to find a new form of activity, Phillips,” you hear Beach say as he offers you a hand. Sprawled ungracefully over the floor, you take it and are pulled up. 

 

 “I see cleaning in your future,” he says, making a mocking mind reading gesture as he puts his fingers to his temples. 

 

 “It’s not over yet, though!” he says more loudly, turning back to the gym. “Keep at it, kids. You can still fall behind Phillips here if you don’t put the graft in.”

 

 Beach gives you a polite smile, then walks away. You move off to the side of the monkey bars, waiting for the rest of your group to finish. As each girl does so, they give you a worried look. When the group moves on to the next exercise, you note that no one is talking to you.

 

 Once your group has completed the last activity, you stand off to the side of the gym on your own. You barely have broken into a sweat. Other girls have noticed. And the boys snigger as they look at you.

 

 You wonder why…
 
 
 You move to the monkey bars once the boys in front are done, seeing their perspiration coating each rung. Tentatively, you wrap your fingers around a sticky bar. You try not to wretch as you push off.

 

 You struggle to move across the bars, especially as you’re trying to avoid touching the sweat. Your efforts are perilous and weak. Halfway across, you lose your grip and tumble to the floor.

 

 Sniggers surround you as you pull yourself up. A few girls from your group cast worried looks in your direction.

 

 You move to the side, waiting for them to finish. No one talks to you when they complete the task.
 
 
 

 Actions

 <>
 
 
 
 
 

 Beach blows his whistle for a final time and you take a seat on the girls' side of the gym, breathing deeply and quickly. A few girls give you encouraging smiles, others give you dark looks. 

 

 
 Turning back to look at the boys, you know why. Most look sullen and dejected, but a few of them still steal glances at you. Unimpressed, you turn your cheek to them.

 

 “Good efforts, good efforts,” Beach says from the centre of the gym. “At least from some of you. Big shout out today to Emily Phillips, who almost went all out.”

 
 
 There is a smattering of applause, but the boys seem distracted and subdued. When they glance up at you, they seem almost embarrassed to be looking.

 
 Turning back to see a large number of boy’s opposite giving you grins, you know why. With no draw for their attention, you ignore their stares.

 

 “Good efforts, good efforts,” Beach says from the centre of the gym. “At least from some of you. Big shout out today to Emily Phillips, who almost went all out.”

 
 
 There are whoops and cheers, mainly from the boys' side of the gym. They are all staring at you.

 

 “Alright boys, settle down,” Beach waves them quiet. “Sounds like a few of them would have liked to see you go all the way.”

 

 There’s more cries and applause. You hear some of the other girls tutting. You look away from your admirers. The curse might not be active for you, but it’s still leading to some very uncomfortable situations.
 
 
 Turning back to see a large number of boy’s opposite giving you grins, you know why. You flash them a grin back, in spite of yourself. 

 

 “Good efforts, good efforts,” Beach says from the centre of the gym. “At least from some of you. Big shout out today to Emily Phillips, who almost went all out.”

 
 
 There are whoops and cheers, mainly from the boys' side of the gym. They are all staring at you.

 

 “Alright boys, settle down,” Beach waves them quiet. “Sounds like a few of them would have liked to see you go all the way.”

 

 There’s more cries and applause. You hear some of the other girls tutting, but you have to admit that being the centre of attention is gratifying. Even if it is a group of smelly boys. And they really do smell good.

 
 

 You are pulled out of your thoughts by Beach continuing to speak. “On the flipside, there’s always a loser. And that loser has won the star prize of spending tonight cleaning up all the sweat you’ve just spilled on my gym floor.”

 

 He turns to face the side of the room with the girls on. “So who’s my lucky guest this evening?” 

 

 
 There is a surprising lack of enthusiasm from the male side of the gymnasium. After struggling with the activities today, the boys seem unsure of themselves.

 
 He glances back at the boys' side of the gym. They whoop and holler at his beckon. They seem confident that none of them will end up last.

 
 

 Actions

 <> 
 
 Beach blows his whistle for a final time and you take a seat on the girls' side of the gym. In spite of what you may want to do, your body instinctively acts to gain its breath back.

 

 
 From the other side of the room, you see the boys talking amongst themselves, their attention for once not on the girls. They appear to be consoling each other. Scared and confused expressions are prevalent.

 

 “Good efforts, good efforts,” Beach says from the centre of the gym. “At least from some of you. But we all know what happens to those who don’t perform. Don’t we, boys?”

 

 There is a surprising lack of enthusiasm from the male side of the gymnasium. After struggling with the activities today, the boys seem unsure of themselves.

 
 From the other side of the room, you see the boys watching the girls like before. A boy from the group ahead grins at you. You sigh, rolling your eyes. The other girls who receive similar attention aren’t so dismissive, blushing.

 

 “Good efforts, good efforts,” Beach says from the centre of the gym. “At least from some of you. But we all know what happens to those who don’t perform. Don’t we, boys?”

 

 He glances back at the boys' side of the gym. They whoop and holler at his beckon. They seem confident that none of them will end up last.

 
 From the other side of the room, you see the boys watching the girls like before. You shift on the bench, aware of the length of your skirt. A boy from the group ahead grins at you. You feel yourself blushing as you take a short breath.

 

 “Good efforts, good efforts,” Beach says from the centre of the gym. “At least from some of you. But we all know what happens to those who don’t perform. Don’t we, boys?”

 

 He glances back at the boys' side of the gym. They whoop and holler at his beckon. They seem confident that none of them will end up last.

 
 

 “So,” Beach says, turning back to your side of the room. “Who’s today’s recipient of my favourite booby prize? Who is spending tonight cleaning up the sweat from my precious gym floor?"

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 Beach blows his whistle for a final time and you take a seat on the girls' side of the gym. Even though there is little room to sit, you get the impression that other girls are trying to avoid being close to you.

 

 
 From the other side of the room, you see the boys talking amongst themselves, their attention for once not on the girls. They appear to be consoling each other. Scared and confused expressions are prevalent.

 

 “Good efforts, good efforts,” he cries, before his eyes rest on you. “At least from some of you.”

 

 No one responds to Beach’s baiting. He seems taken aback by the lack of enthusiasm in the room, scowling back at the boys.

 
 From the other side of the room, you see the boys watching the girls like before. Their attention is on other girls. You hear some excited whispering behind you and a few giggles. The girls are still responding to the attention.

 

 “Good efforts, good efforts,” he cries, before his eyes rest on you. “At least from some of you.”

 

 Chuckles echo from around the gym. Mostly from the boys, but even some girls join them too.

 

 “We all know what happens to those who don’t perform. Don’t we, boys?”, Beach continues. The boys whoop and holler. Most of them are staring right back at you.

 
 

 “So,” Beach says, looking to your side of the room. He dramatically avoids looking at you. “Who’s today’s recipient of my favourite booby prize? Who is spending tonight cleaning up the sweat from my precious gym floor?"

 

 **Actions**

 <> 

 Beach’s eyes rest on Heather. “Miss Oats, you’ve got a date with a duster.”

 

 “Miss Oats,” Beach cries out. “Congratulations!”

 

 
 There is a smattering of applause from the boys' side, but you see the signs of relief in some of the faces. The girls, by contrast, are muttering amongst themselves, each peppered with frowns and confusion. Objectively, some of the boys did worse today. You glance at Heather. She looks shocked.

 

 Beach seems unnerved by the response. “Get to the showers, then,” he mutters. “Dismissed."

 
 There are cheers from the boys and are relieved sighs from some of the girls. You watch Heather carefully. Her face drops. Crestfallen.

 

 “That’s all, folks,” Beach says. “Get to the showers!”

 
 

 
 
 “Oh, Phillips!” Beach says as you stand. “Stay behind too. I’d like a word with you.”

 

 There’s a few raised eyebrows directed your way as the other students rush out, ready to shower and go home. You remain seated. Within seconds, only yourself and Heather remain. You look at her, but she keeps her eyes focused on the floor, avoiding your gaze.

 

 Actions

 <>
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Everyone begins to rush out, ready to shower and go home.

 

 Actions

 <>
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 His eyes roam across the girls’ faces. When his eyes meet yours, he smirks. You look away.

 

 “Miss Oats,” Beach cries out. “Congratulations!” Heather’s face drops.

 

 
 There is a smattering of applause from the boys' side, but you see the signs of relief in some of the faces. The girls, by contrast, are muttering amongst themselves, each peppered with frowns and confusion. Objectively, some of the boys did worse today. You glance at Heather. She looks shocked.

 

 Beach seems unnerved by the response. “Get to the showers, then,” he mutters. “Dismissed.”

 
 The boys cry out and some of the girls sigh in relief. Including, you notice, you. 

 

 The gym teacher turns back to the class. “Get to the showers. Show’s over!”

 

 Everyone begins to rush out, ready to shower and go home. You glance at Heather as you walk by, but she stares down into the dirty floor.

 
 

 “Don’t get too cocky, Phillips,” Beach says, as you walk by. “It was touch and go there for a while. You better put in the effort if you don’t want to be taking Heather’s place.”

 

 Actions

 <>
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 You look down to the floor. You know what is coming. The shadow of your stocky gym teacher falls over you.

 

 “That’s right,” you hear Beach cry. “Emily Phillips. You just earned yourself an evening cleaning up this gym.”

 

 
 There is a smattering of applause from the boys' side, but you see the signs of relief in some of the faces. The girls, by contrast, are muttering amongst themselves, each peppered with frowns and confusion. They give you sympathetic looks. Even against your meagre efforts today, some of the boys did worse.

 

 Beach seems unnerved by the response. “Get to the showers, then,” he mutters. “Dismissed. Except you, Phillips.” He gives you a grin and walks out.

 
 Your eyes flick upward as you hear the laughter. Everyone, including the girls, is chuckling at you. The only exception is Heather, who just looks relieved. 

 

 “Fun’s over today!” you hear Beach say as you share a consoling look with Heather. “Get to the showers. Except you, Phillips.” He gives you a grin and walks out.

 
 

 With the squeak of sneakers, everyone filters out of the room. Heather smiles sympathetically as she passes. Soon you are the only one left in the gym, hearing the sounds of students changing and laughing, but you sit alone waiting.

 

 Actions

 <>
 
 
 
 
 
 

 “Very good Phillips. Very good indeed,” you hear Beach say from off to the side as he walks over. You turn to look at him. He places his foot on the bench you are sitting on and puts his hand on his knee, leaning forward towards you. Your eyes flick down at his short shorts, noticing there’s just enough slack to see far up in there. 

 

 “Thank you sir,” you mumble, looking up to meet his gaze. 

 

 
 You notice how he's thinning on top and has nostril hairs creeping out of his nose. He clearly still works out, but age is catching up with him in a manner that simple exercise can't counteract.

 
 You notice his greying stubble and his ruffled salt and pepper hair. Whilst he wouldn’t feature on the cover of a men’s health magazine, there’s something still strong and chiselled about his physical demeanour.

 
 

 “With agility and speed like that, you could be in with a shot at a scholarship,” the teacher says with sincerity. “Cheerleading is not just short skirts and pom poms. You can get into some top schools with it.”

 

 He leans forward, leaning on his knee. You notice the veins more apparent with age, creeping out from underneath his short shorts like tendrils.You see his thigh muscles flexing, clearly still powerful in spite of his age. His shorts also ruffle up around the tops of his legs. You think you can faintly see the outline of something underneath the fabric…

 

 “If she hadn’t already asked you, chat to Christina,” Beach tells you. “You can try-out on the football field after school. I think you’d have a good chance, if you asked me.”

 

 You meet his eye. He seems earnest. 

 

 “Alright, get yourself to the showers,” the coach says, turning his attention to the other girl in the gym who sits behind you. “Heather, it's your turn. Come here.”

 

 You move towards the exit as Heather stands and walks towards Coach Beach. You only look back once, as you open the gym doors, to see Beach leaning in closely to Heather as she looks down at the floor.

 

 **Actions**

 <>

title: PEClean
text:
After a long few minutes, the doors to the gym swing back open and Coach Beach walks in, carrying a bucket of warm water and an arm full of cleaning products. He drops them next to you.

 

 “Alright, Phillips,” he says to you. “If PE isn’t your specialist subject, maybe you’ll excel at cleaning. I want this gym spick and span by the time I get back.” He glances at the stopwatch dangling around his neck. “One hour should do it. So. Get going.” 

 

 Beach waits for you to fiddle with the cleaning products, then turns and walks out of the gym. Knowing what you have to do, the smells of perspiration and drying sweat seems ever more pungent. You glance up at the clock above the basketball net. Fifty-nine minutes to go.

 

 Picking up the cleaning equipment, you consider how best to tackle this.

 
 Coach Beach walks in after a few minutes, carrying the bucket and a variety of cleaning products.

 

 “Back again, Phillips?” he says to you. “Some might think you’ve found your calling. Get on with it. You know what to do.”

 

 He nods to the bucket, then walks out of the gym. Trying to ignore the putrid smells that surround you, you pick up the equipment and consider what to do.

 
 

 Actions

 <>
 
 
 
 
 

 <>
 
 
 
 
 

 <>
 
 
 
 

 You pick up the bucket and soak a cloth inside it, then get down on your hands and knees to start cleaning. 

 

 Getting your nose close to the ground, you can almost taste the smell of bad hygiene and teenage body odour. You scrub vigorously, working up a sweat. Your polo shirt hangs down and more than once you feel it absorb the dirty water on the floor, touching your breasts.

 

 As the minutes tick away, your mind drifts. You find yourself considering how long some of this sweat has been etched into the floor, and how many of the people you know have spilled the perspiration that you are now inhaling. 

 

 
 You scrub hard, thankful that the curse doesn't have any sway over you. Your mind drifts to other topics, thinking of Jennifer, then Emily, and how you can help her survive here.

 

 Time passes and soon you find the hour has gone.

 
 Scrubbing hard, your mind fills with thoughts of Charlton men, playing basketball in school short shorts, their muscular bodies glistening.

 

 You bite your lip as the images refuse to fade. For the rest of the hour, you keep returning to the thought of mopping up the sweat of taut men playing sports in the gym.

 
 

 **Actions**

 <>

 You kneel down in front of the benches so you can spray them with cleaning products and wipe a cloth over their surfaces. Despite being alone in the gym, you double-check to make sure your skirt is tucked in between your legs.

 

 The mixture of chemicals and grime adds a noticeable humidity to the stench and soon you feel yourself sweating. When you move to where the boys were sitting, the odours only grow stronger. 

 

 
 You hear laughter from outside the gym and sigh as you lament on how unfair you find this. Here you are, cleaning up after a bunch of men, who objectively did worse than you.

 

 Reflecting, you know you could have tried harder. Now that the curse has no impact on you, putting in some physical effort wouldn’t have cost anything. You circle back around to the question - why are you here, exactly?

 

 For the rest of the hour, you try to concentrate on cleaning, keeping the thoughts out of your mind.

 
 You hear laughter from outside the gym and sigh as you lament on how unfair you find this. Here you are, cleaning up after a bunch of men, kneeling in their own dirt and perspiration, whilst they laugh and get clean in hot, fresh showers.

 

 You grow conscious of inhaling a whiff of drying sweat as you wipe the benches down, unable to keep your mind from drifting to the images your mind conjures. Of the boys, making the most of their showers...

 

 Consumed with the mental pictures repeating through your mind, you find time quickly passes. 

 
 

 **Actions**

 <> 

 Picking up the bucket, you take a single cloth and walk around the edges of the gym, wiping down equipment as you pass by.

 

 The smells of dozens of sweaty students threaten to overwhelm you. You run a cloth across the vaulting box and the monkey bars, but make no attempt to remove the persistent stains. More often than you’d like, you glance up at the clock to find that since you last looked barely a minute has passed by.

 

 
 You hear laughter outside the gym, but ignore it. You breathe in the repellant smell and curse yourself for ending up here. Spending the hour half-heartedly looking for simple things to wipe down, time passes slowly.

 
 You hear laughter outside the gym, but try to ignore it. You don't want to imagine what's happening in the boys' changing rooms. Based on the smell in here, they could do with a cold shower. A refreshing one too.

 

 Spending the hour half-heartedly looking for simple things to wipe down, time passes slowly.

 
 

 **Actions**

 <>

 As soon as the clock hits the top of the hour, the double doors swing open and Coach Beach walks back in, looking around the gym.

 

 ”Nice work, Phillips,” he says, surveying the floor. “You’ve even managed to get rid of spots that I think I made when I was at school here."

 

 He then glances at you. You become conscious of your ruffled hair. Your sweaty face. And your polo shirt, soaked with dirty water. 

 

 He gives you a grin. You look up to the stocky coach, noticing again his large chest and biceps. In spite of his age, he looks ripped. You coyly grin back to him. 

 

 Actions

 <>

 As soon as the clock hits the top of the hour, the double doors swing open and Coach Beach walks back in, looking around the gym.

 

 ”Not bad,” he says, slowly walking up and down the benches. Floor could have done with a bit of work, though.”

 

 You watch him as he surveys your efforts. You catch a whiff of him as he passes, a mixture of sweaty and musky cologne. You briefly wonder if he’s been working out whilst you’ve been cleaning. And then idly wonder where he might go, after class. 

 

 “Good enough,” he says, turning back to you. He gives you a long look. You become aware of how much bigger he is compared to you. You meekly smile at him.

 

 Actions

 <>

 As soon as the clock hits the top of the hour, the double doors swing open and Coach Beach walks back in, looking around the gym.

 

 ”Did you take a nap instead, Phillips?” he asks, looking around the room. “Or do you find that cleaning is beneath you?”

 

 Beach runs a finger down one of the monkey bars nearby and holds it out to you. It’s covered in a black sticky residue, a mixture of sweat and dust. “Does that look clean to you, Phillips?”

 

 You don’t reply. Beach snorts with frustration. “The carrot and stick approach doesn’t appear to work with you, doesn’t it? Might need a bigger stick. For now, I'll just dock your grades.”

 

 Actions

 <>

 <= 2>>
 
 
 "Good work as always, Phillips," Beach says to you. "Gym continues to look spick and span. Maybe you've found your calling. Do you do home visits?"

 

 You catch his eyes and a look is shared between the two of you. You know exactly what a home visit would entail. Does that excite you?

 

 Beach breaks the tension with a small smile. "Alright Phillips, off you go. We can discuss another time." He lowers his voice. "Maybe off-site."

 

 You say nothing, wordlessly handing him the cleaning equipment as you prepare to leave.
