title: PrologueEmilysRoom
text:
**Emily's Room**

 [image: ./images/Emilys_Room.png]

 
 
 Entering Emily’s room is enough to make you feel even more alien in your body. You are standing in an eighteen year old girl’s bedroom, surrounded by posters of female popstars, plush cushions and a table full of make-up. Yet this is where you are about to get changed. Into the clothes you'll be wearing out for the day.

 

 You take a deep breath and open up her wardrobe, looking for her school uniform.

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 You pull back the wardrobe door and are struck by the array of fabrics and styles Emily has collected. You always remembered her being plain and a tomboy, but some of these newer clothes are stylish, bold and dare you think it, sexy.

 

 Pushing them aside, you look down the rack and find Emily's spare uniform. It sits on some hangers together.

 

 You take it out and throw it on the bed. A white blouse. Pleated short skirt. A school tie. This would have seemed archaic when you were at school. You can't believe that Emily has to wear this.

 

 *That you have to wear this.*

 

 Bracing yourself for the next part, you reach down and open Emily's underwear drawer. You are relieved that the great majority is what you've seen in the laundry. Scrappy sports briefs and everyday panties. You try to avoid touching the more lacy ones, which there are definitely more than you were expecting or are comfortable with.

 

 You pull out some white cotton panties and a white bra, thinking about how Jennifer dresses in lighter blouses. You also take out a pair of uniform socks. Thigh high and gray, matching the uniform. 

 

 Finally, you look to Emily's shoe rack inside the wardrobe. You grimace. Her school shoes wouldn't satisfy a stripper, but the two inch heel is still more than you've had to walk in before.

 

 **Actions**

 <>
 
 You pull down the panties you are currently wearing and pull up the new ones. Then, making sure you've completely turned your back on the mirror, pull your sundress off.

 

 You stare down for a moment, looking at the breasts. On your chest. You thought you'd be sickened by seeing the boobs that belong to your sister, but as you notice them rise and fall with your breathing, you can't see them as anyone else's but yours.

 

 You reach out and grab the white bra, clipping it behind your back and adjusting your breasts to feel comfortable. Then you continue to get changed, putting on your blouse, your skirt, tie, and finally pulling up your socks over your legs so only a tiny bit of skin can be seen between the hem of your skirt and the top of your socks.

 

 Only now turning, you stare at yourself in the mirror. You see your sister staring back at you, yes. But you are also aware that it's you standing in front of the mirror. 

 

 In a girl's body, wearing a skirt and thigh high socks and a school uniform. 

 

 *How do you feel?*

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>
 
 You have no other words for it. You are horrified. Only this morning, you were a twenty-five year old man whose only body issues were you might be a little too skinny. Now you stare at yourself in the mirror, and you can only see an eighteen year old school girl.

 

 You quickly look away, grab the school shoes and buckle them up, then march out the door.

 

 **Actions**

 <>
 
 The feeling is not exactly what you're used to, but you recognise it all the same. You feel flushed. There is a tingling from your new vagina. Looking in the mirror at yourself, you are feeling aroused.

 

 *You're curious, aren't you?*

 

 You quickly look away, grab the school shoes and buckle them up, then march out the door.

title: PrologueFreshPot
text:
**Fresh Pot Cafe**

 [image: ./images/Fresh_Pot.png]

 

 Complete with a ringing bell above the door, The Fresh Pot Cafe feels from another time. You assume the big chains haven’t moved into Charlton as there's just no money to be made here.

 

 As you step in you see Ron, the sweaty middle-aged owner, cursing and muttering as he works the grill out the back. More pleasant is the warm smile from the young woman behind the counter, who you’ve struck up a rapport with since moving here. “Morning !” she says warmly. “Your usual? Be with you in a minute.”

 

 “Thanks Flo,” you reply. You stand at the counter and watch her prepare a coffee for the only other customer, Martin, who sits at a table off to the side.

 

 **Actions**

 <>
 
 You only know Martin after your brother Brock struck up a friendship with him over the summer before he went to University. Martin is a hulk of a man, scowling and snarling in equal measure. You know Brock used to drink with him in McTafeys, the local bar in the town. From the state of Brock the next morning, you know that Martin really likes to drink.

 

 “Hey nerd,” Martin greets you. “How’s your sister?”

 

 You remember that you bumped into him with Brock and Emily when you were all out shopping. Ever since then Martin has shown a creepy interest in Emily. 

 

 “All good, Martin,” you say, noncommittally. 

 

 “You’ll have to bring her out to McTafey’s one night,” he says, smirking. ”If she’s anything like her brother, she knows how to party.”

 

 **Actions**

 <> 
 
 You stand back, waiting idly for Flo to finish serving Martin. With a fresh coffee, she walks around the counter towards him, placing it down on the table. As she does so, his hand slips around her waist. She gasps as he pulls her closer to him.

 

 “Thanks darl,” he says. “Why don’t you sit down and join me?” You watch as his hand brushes her arse.

 

 “I need to get back to serve his coffee," she stammers, clearly not comfortable with his advances. You glance through to the kitchen, but Ron is either unaware or disinterested. He just continues to work the grill.

 

 “He can wait,” you hear Martin reply. “Why don’t you show me some attention?”

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>
 
 “Hey, leave her alone!” you say, stepping forward. Martin’s head spins around to look at you. He scowls and lets go of Flo. She leaps a step back, out of harm’s reach and away from the new conflict.

 

 Martin stands and steps up towards you. “What’s it to you, nerd?” he spits, staring you up and down. You don’t move, neither towards nor back from him.

 

 “You better watch yourself,” Martin barks, right in your face. “Just because I’m drinking pals with your brother doesn’t mean that I won’t beat the shit out of you.”

 

 You remain silent, staring back at him. You notice Flo looking between the pair of you. Her eyes are wide and lip quivers.

 

 “Fuck this,” he snorts, finally breaking the silence. “I’ve got deliveries to make anyway.” He steps forward and shoulder barges past you, nearly knocking you off your feet. “I’ll see you later, Flo.”

 

 The sound of the bell ringing is the only indicator Martin has left. Flo looks at you and smiles weakly. “Thanks for that, .”

 

 She goes back around the counter and makes your coffee, a tense silence hanging in the air. “On the house,” she whispers, placing the take-away cup on the counter. “Thank you, again.”

 

 **Actions**

 <>
 
 You watch in silence, unable or unwilling to intervene. Martin pulls at Flo again, forcing her on to his lap. His muscular arms wrap around her waist and his hands reach down to caress her exposed thighs. “That’s a good girl,” you hear him mutter.

 Flo looks over to you, eyes pleading. Martin follows her stare, then meets your own gaze. “This is how real men treat their women,” he tells you. “Maybe one day you’ll learn that.”

 

 The waitress tries to get out of his grasp, but he only pulls her tighter. You watch as his hand moves over her pale skin, her waitress skirt riding up and threatening to reveal her underwear.

 

 “What’s going on here?” you hear Ron bark, as he comes out of the kitchen. 

 

 Martin releases Flo slightly, but still you see what Ron sees - his waitress sitting in the lap of one of his customers, legs exposed and looking flustered.

 

 “Cut that crap out in public,” Ron barks. “If you want to be a slut, Florence, then do it on your own time.”

 

 Only then does Martin relinquish the hold he has on her. She leaps up, smoothing out her skirt and looking between her boss and Martin. “Yes Mr. Denver,” she finally mutters to Ron, then runs out to the kitchen.

 

 “Women these days,” Martin says to Ron as he stands up. “Just can’t control themselves. I’ve got deliveries to make and all she can think about is sex.”

 

 He walks towards the door, smirking as he passes you. “Say hi to your sister from me,” he says, exiting the shop.

 

 There is a moment of silence between you and Ron once Martin has gone, then the cafe owner sighs and goes back to the kitchen. Looks like you’re going to work without a coffee.

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 The Charlton Hotel is decorated like a heritage building, all dark oak surfaces and ageing carpets that look like they haven’t been replaced in years.

 

 As you enter, you are greeted by the concierge Lennox Matox. You recognise his usual look of disdain from the few times you've been here. He smiles thinly as you approach.

 

 “Good afternoon. Are you looking to dine, or would you be looking to rent a room?”

 

 “Lunch please,” Annie says, ignoring his insinuation. He gathers two menus from his desk and leads down the corridor towards the restaurant.

 

 On the way, a young woman almost runs into you with a cleaning trolley. You sidestep quickly, avoiding a collision. She gasps and begins to apologise, but you are distracted by her uniform. Not for the first time when visiting here, you are taken aback by the french maid attire the owner mandates his staff wear.

 

 “Watch where you're pushing that thing, Miss. Cinders!” Lennox barks. “We wouldn’t want to ruin our guests' fine garments with your dirty cleaning mops.”

 

 You see her blushing, but she nods and hurries off.

title: PrologueHotelRestaurant
text:
**Charlton Hotel - Restaurant**

 [image: ./images/Hotel_Restaurant.png]

 

 The restaurant is less of a fine dining option and more a gastro pub built into the hotel. The bar runs down one wall, making space for dozens of old wooden tables to be spread across the floor.

 

 Lennox gestures to one and puts the menus down on the table. “Our staff will be with you shortly,” he says, then walks off.

 

 You take a seat opposite Annie, who takes off her coat and crosses her legs as she looks at the menu. “I fancy a salad today,” she says. “I’m watching my weight. But choose anything you like. My shout.”

 

 Looking over the menu yourself, the steak leaps out at you. Some iron would really help kick your brain into gear. But you look to Annie, remembering she’s buying and that a salad would be more cost effective.

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>
 
 “The steak looks great,” you say. “Don’t worry, I’ll get up and order.”

 

 You stand up and she smiles gratefully.

 

 **Actions**

 <>
 
 “I’m good with the salad too,” you reply. “Let me at least order."

 

 You stand up and she smiles gratefully.
 
 

 **Actions**

 <>
 
 You go to the bar and stand waiting. You can hear some noise from the kitchen, but there doesn’t seem to be anyone here that could serve you.

 

 There’s a bell on the counter. After waiting a minute, you hit it. It dings out, then silence returns.

 

 You wait another minute. Then two. Still no one has come out to serve you. You glance back to Annie. She smiles back at you, but offers no solution.

 

 Again, you hit the bell. Another minute passes. You press it again.

 

 This time you hear a long list of expletives erupt from the kitchen. You can tell it’s in French, but you have no idea what they mean.

 

 You then hear the clip clopping of heels from the entrance corridor and turn to see the maid from earlier trying to run in some very high heels, looking flustered.

 

 “I’m so sorry,” she says, coming around the bar. She can be no more than twenty, petite and small-framed. She is struggling to move fast in those shoes. “What can I get for you?”

 

 The kitchen door suddenly slams open like an old western. A fat, bulbous man covered in grease stains strides out behind the counter, looking between you and the maid.

 

 “Mon dieu!" he barks at you. "Please tell me you have not been waiting long, no?”

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <> 
 
 “We’ve just arrived,” you lie, looking at the maid knowingly.

 

 The fat chef eyes you glaringly, then curses again in French. “That bell has been ringing for ages!” he says, turning his rage towards the maid. “You have cost us paying customers who must have left!”

 

 The maid looks sheepish, barely looking up at him. “I was cleaning the rooms,” she stammers.

 

 “Cleaning doesn’t make me orders!” he replies loudly. “You are a lazy girl!”

 

 “I didn’t see anyone else here,” you say to him. “Maybe some kids were fooling around.”

 

 He once again eyes you darkly, then dismisses you with a wave of his hand. “Serve these guests,” he tells the maid. “And bring me orders!”

 

 He strides back into the kitchen, slamming the doors as he goes.

 

 The maid looks at you from behind the counter, mouths ‘Thank you,’ and asks for your order.

 

 You tell her what you and Annie want and she diligently puts it through on the till. You notice her name badge, ‘Andrea.’ “Thanks Andrea”, you say as she hands you a receipt. “Good job.”

 

 She smiles again, a genuine smile this time. Then saunters away to give the order to the chef back in the kitchen.

 

 **Actions**

 <> 
 
 “We’ve been waiting some time,” you tell him honestly.

 

 His face turns even redder. He looks directly at the maid, simmering. “You are a lazy girl, Andrea! Paying guests are waiting for my food and you are letting them wait. They are starving! What a useless, lazy girl!"

 

 The maid looks sheepishly to the floor. “I was cleaning the rooms,” she says.

 

 “Cleaning doesn’t give me orders!” he replies loudly. “Get out of my sight, I will serve them myself!”

 

 She scuttles off and you listen to her heels clapping as she disappears into the hotel. You look over at the enraged chef behind the counter, who watches her go before turning his attention to you.

 

 “Silly English women, all the same!” he laments. “None of them want to work in this restaurant. They stay for a day. Stay for a week. Then quit! And this maid… Andrea… she comes to work here, she does nothing!"

 

 He curses again in French and sighs loudly. “What did you want to eat?”

 

 You tell him the order and he pounds some keys on the till. He throws a receipt over the counter and then strides back to the kitchen, slamming the doors as he goes.

 

 **Actions**

 <> 
 
 Taking a deep breath, you walk back over and sit down with Annie. She looks up when she sees you. “Everything okay?” she asks. You nod and she lets it go, not mentioning it any further.

 

 Annie soon relaxes you, mixing small talk with some general chat about the office. You learn that she’s been working for Mr. Thompson for about a year since graduating from Charlton Upper School. 

 

 “How do you like working for Mr. Thompson?” you ask, gently probing about how she feels about your hot-tempered boss.

 

 She smiles, coyly. “Fishing for gossip, ? You might need to get me another drink before my lips get loose.”

 

 You pause and she takes the silence as an invitation to continue. “Mr. Thompson is okay. He’s a stern boss. You just need to know how to handle a stern man.”

 

 Her eyes sparkle as she looks directly at you. She smiles. “How is Jennifer, by the way? I went to school with her. Did she tell you that? She was always so… prudish.”

 

 You blush, thinking about your girlfriend and whether you should be discussing her with a woman who you barely know.

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>
 
 “Jennifer’s just got standards,” you say, trying to defend your girlfriend without being aggressive. “She’s not prudish when you live up to them.”

 

 Annie laughs. “Well, I’m glad she has such a loyal man that’s matches her expectations,” she says. “There’s such slim pickings in Charlton that some of us can’t be so picky with our boyfriends.”

 

 The conversation moves on and you find yourself talking about more comfortable topics, such as your parents and where you grew up. Eventually your food comes. You get stuck into it.

 

 **Actions**

 <>
 
 
 
 
 
 “Jennifer is just a little shy until you get to know her,” you admit. “She’s not that experienced with guys.”

 

 Annie nods. “She always was a bit of a tease at school. Acting so innocent and demure, but never would let any guy near her panties. Is she like that still, ? A bit of a tease?”

 

 You lack of words for a response is thankfully interrupted as your food arrives, breaking the tension.

 

 **Actions**

 <>
 
 
 
 

 You start to eat your salad. Annie picks at hers, despite it being tiny.

 

 You feel calmer as you eat the lettuce leaves and carrot sticks littered across the plate. You catch sight of a steak being carried through the restaurant by Andrea and for a moment regret your choice. But taking another mouthful of the salad you admit that even bland food can be appealing. It also won't hurt your waistline, you think.

 

 *When did you start considering your waistline?*

 

 As you eat, Annie expertly turns chat back to more mundane topics away from Jennifer. Even so, you can’t help but feel an underlying subtext beneath that innocent chat.

 

 Eventually you both finish your meals and drinks. Annie looks at you as she puts on her coat again. “This was lovely. Thanks , we should do this again sometime. Maybe after work. If Jennifer doesn’t mind?”

 

 You say nothing, avoiding a reply.

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 You carve off a healthy slab of steak and put it into your mouth, tasting the juices instantly. You are careful not to dribble in front of Annie.

 

 She watches you eat, picking at her salad. You note that even though it's tiny, she seems disinterested. You do have to admit, it looks a little bland.

 

 As you eat, Annie expertly turns chat back to more mundane topics away from Jennifer. Even so, you can’t help but feel an underlying subtext beneath that innocent chat.

 

 Eventually you both finish your meals and drinks. Annie looks at you as she puts on her coat again. “This was lovely. Thanks , we should do this again sometime. Maybe after work. If Jennifer doesn’t mind?”

 

 You say nothing, avoiding a reply.

title: PrologueJenniferDialogue
text:
“Dan was a total jackass again today. He made some lewd comments about Annie. Just completely inappropriate for a workplace.”

 

 “Annie?” Jennifer asks, not looking back from her cooking. “Annie Clancy? What did you do?”

 

 
 “I didn’t want to cause a fuss,” you say, hearing the flatness in your response. “He’s well liked by the boss.”

 

 “I wish men wouldn’t talk like that at work,” you hear Jennifer say. “Even if it is Annie Clancy.”

 
 “I told him it wasn’t appropriate. He shut up quickly. Hopefully he’ll keep those thoughts to himself from now on.”

 

 “Good,” Jennifer says. “Comments like that are never appropriate. Even if they are about Annie Clancy.”

 
 

 **Actions**

 <>

 “I ran into my brother’s friend, Martin, at Fresh Pot,” you begin. “He was harassing that waitress, Flo. Getting real handsy with her.”

 

 Jennifer turns, her expression serious. “Oh god,” she says. “What did you do?”

 

 
 “I told him to leave her alone,” you reply. “I thought for a moment he was going to fight me, but guys like that are all talk. He left pretty quickly.”

 

 “That’s so chivalrous of you,” Jennifer says, smiling. “Some guys just think that girls are just pieces of meat. You don’t know how difficult it is to be in that situation. It’s nice that someone stood up for Flo.”

 

 You smile, renewed with a sense of confidence from choosing to do the right thing.

 
 “I didn’t want to cause a fuss,” you say, with a little sigh. “He’s a big guy and he was being pretty aggressive.”

 

 Jennifer turns to look at you, a little disappointment on her face. “I understand,” she says after a moment. “Some guys are just all muscle and no brains. I’m glad you didn’t get hurt. But poor Flo.”

 

 She turns back to the kitchen top. You can’t help but feel a bit emasculated, especially when Jennifer referred to some guys being all muscle.

 
 

 **Actions**

 <>

 
 “Clive and Gordon were being their usual selves this morning. Clive gave me stick about not doing a real man’s job. I told him that his work relied on me fixing all the problems that the booking system was causing.”

 

 Jennifer smiles at you, giggling. “They won’t be saying that in a few years, when you are making a ton of money and they have cracked skin and bad backs from all the labour. Plus, I find your intelligence attractive.”

 
 “Clive and Gordon were being their usual selves this morning, Clive gave me stick about not doing a real man’s job. I told him that I wasn’t built for manual labour, and Gordon said that I should come by his gym to lift some weights.”

 

 You notice Jennifer raises an eyebrow. “Well, it wouldn’t hurt to try and build up some muscle. Gordon looks pretty good and he's even a bit older than you. You'd look so manly with toned arms too.”

 

 She turns back to cooking. You glance down at your arms, wondering if she thinks you are too skinny.

 
 

 **Actions**

 <>

 “The chef at the Charlton Hotel really tore into one of the staff at lunch. She was rushed off her feet and they seem to be short-staffed, and he just shouted at her in front of the whole restaurant for not serving us quickly enough.”

 

 “That place is just the pits,” Jennifer replies. “And the uniforms they make the girls wear are disgusting.” She turns to look at you. “What happened?”

 

 
 “I told him he was misunderstood. He shut up quickly after that.”

 

 “Good,” Jennifer says, turning back to the food. “I hate that place."

 
 “Well, I told him the truth. That was running late,” you say. You see Jennifer wince as the words come out of your mouth. “I think she probably got in trouble.”

 

 “That place goes through staff so quickly,” she says, reflecting. “Maybe she’ll find another job that isn’t so sleazy.”

 
 

 **Actions**

 <>

 “I had lunch with Annie, our secretary,” you say. You hear Jennifer scraping the dinner off the baking tray more sternly than before. “I didn’t know you went to school with her.”

 

 “I didn’t like school,” Jennifer says with her back to you. “She wasn’t exactly in my group of friends either. What did she want?”

 

 
 “She said you were a bit.. Prudish,” you begin, realising this conversation could go badly quickly. “But I stuck up for you. Put her in her place.”

 

 Jennifer turns, hands on her hips. You can see the blood rushing to her face. “Prudish? What a little bitch,” she mutters. 

 

 You watch her for a moment, simmering. Then she takes a deep breath and exhales. She smiles at you. “Thank you for coming to my defence. She is such a piece of work.”

 

 You smile back and watch her return back to cooking. A sense of relief washes over you.

 
 “She said you were a bit.. Prudish,” you begin, realising this conversation could go badly quickly. “I said you were just shy until you got to know people.”

 

 Jennifer turns, hands on her hips. You can see the blood rushing to her face. “You said what?” she says angrily. “You agreed with her? Do I look prudish?” she says, dramatically gesturing to her skirt. 

 

 She turns her back to you again, scraping the food. “I didn’t know that girls like Annie Clancy were your thing," she mutters under her breath.

 

 You begin to apologise, but she cuts you off mid sentence. “It’s fine,” she says.

 

 You stand in the living room, staring back at her. You know it isn’t.

 
 

 **Actions**

 <>

 "To sum up, it's been okay," you comment. "Different day, same problems with angry bosses and strange work colleagues, I would have liked my Sunday to myself, though. Emily's still struggling with school and I wish I could have helped her more today." You shrug, giving her a smile. "I wish I led a more exciting life, but what can I tell you?"

 

 Jennifer glances back and flashes you a smile. "Oh does the city boy think that quiet life in Charlton isn't exciting enough for him?" she jokes.

 

 You smile. "Enough about me. How was your day?"

 

 **Actions**

 <>

title: PrologueJennifersApartment
text:
**Jennifer's Apartment**

 [image: ./images/Jennifers_Apartment.png]

 

 The flat is decorated in pastels and neutral colours, feeling warm and homely. This is only emphasised by the smell of home cooking drifting through Jennifer’s small home. You suspect she's been cooking all evening.

 

 Once you take your coat off and sit down on the sofa, you look into the kitchen at your girlfriend making the final touches to dinner. She wears the short skirt and crop top that she sent you a picture of. She looks over her shoulder as she prepares dinner, noticing you watching her. She grins. “How was work? I can't believe you had to work on a Sunday.”

 
 Jennifer continues to cook, turning back to you regularly to listen.

 
 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>

 <>

 <>
 
 “Thankfully my day was more uneventful,” she says to you. “The department store was pretty busy, and my boss kept making comments about how I needed to smile like a singer and dress to impress. He’s such an oddball.”

 

 Jennifer has told you so much about her boss, Terry Evans, the owner of the general store. Jennifer is convinced he’s strange. You offer her a sympathetic look as she continues.

 

 “His daughter was in today. I think she’s in Emily’s year. Head cheerleader. So spoilt. All he could do was give her anything she wanted in the store. Meanwhile, I’m having to serve all the customers and help manage the changing rooms at the same time.”

 

 She finishes putting the meal on two plates and brings them to the dining room table. “I can’t wait until Emily finishes school and we can get out of here,” she says as she serves dinner. “Just the two of us.”

 

 You smile again and sit down, tucking into the amazing meal Jennifer has cooked for you. You can’t help but stare at her breasts in-between bites, noticing how her new top pushes them up for you to see. She smiles a little as she catches your stares.

 

 “Emily is struggling a bit in Maths class,” you comment, trying to make conversation and quell your arousal. “Some girl even gave her an amulet and told her that it would help her pass her test.”

 

 Jennifer frowns at your reply. “What amulet?” she asks.

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>
 
 “An old one,” you continue. “With a green emerald. It came with a note that said that someone could help her when she needed it, if they thought about her hard enough. It was written on old paper, like it was really old.”

 

 Jennifer looks at you, cautiously. “I’d be careful with that, if I was you. That school is a strange place. It’s like it hasn’t moved on since the last century.”

 

 You nod. “I’m sure it’s nothing.” 

 

 “Just be careful,” she says again. “Don’t do anything foolish.”

 

 **Actions**

 <>
 
 “Some hokey new age nonsense that girls are into these days,” you say. “You know teenage girls. There are affirmations and healing gems. The point is, it’s not going to help Emily. She just needs to knuckle down and get on with her studies.”

 

 You notice Jennifer’s eye twitch, but she nods politely. “Well, keep discouraging her about anything like that,” she says. “That school is a strange place. Just tell her to concentrate on her studies and get out of there.”

 

 You nod, noting Jennifer’s sudden serious tone. But you continue eating.

 

 **Actions**

 <> 
 
 You eat the last bite of your meal and push the plate to the middle of the table. You look to Jennifer and notice that she has barely touched her dinner. “Not hungry?” you ask.

 

 She looks at you with a glint in her eye and stands up, walking around the table. “Oh I’m hungry. Just not for food.” She sits down in your lap and moves her leg over you, straddling you in her very short skirt.

 

 “How hungry are you?” she purrs before kissing you deeply, her soft lips touching yours.

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>
 
 Jennifer grins, and grinds her hips against your groin as she looks into your eyes. "What do you think of my silly little skirt?" she asks.

 

 You look down, watching it ride up and expose her underwear. A lacy black thong. Glancing back up, you smile. "I think it's great."

 

 "I can tell," she says softly, as you feel your penis grow hard in your pants. "It seems you like my panties too."

 

 You lean in to kiss Jennifer's neck and she arches her head back, welcoming your lips. You kiss her gently and tenderly, then reach with your hand under her skirt -

 

 An offensively loud phone ring erupts from the landline mounted in the kitchen, making you jump. 

 

 "Shit!" she says, unwrapping herself from you and smooths her skirt down as she walks over to the phone and picks it up.

 

 "Hello?" Jen answers in a neutral voice, before her eyes widen. "Oh, hi Daddy!", she says in a higher pitch than you've come to know she only uses when talking to her father. Jennifer meets your eye and mouths "Sorry!" to you as she begins the conversation.

 

 You sigh, and walk over to the sofa. Based on past experience, you know she's going to be a while. You turn on the TV and put on an old sitcom to pass the time.

 

 Forty-five minutes later, Jennifer comes back in from the kitchen. She smiles, apologetically. 

 

 "It's okay," you say before she can speak. "Come here and let's watch TV." She snuggles over to you as you wrap your arm around her. "This is a really good one. Have you seen it?"

 

 She looks up at you, shaking her head. Then rests her head on your chest as you watch TV together.

 

 **Actions**

 “I actually… have to go,” you stammer. “I need an early night and I said I’d help Emily study tomorrow.”

 

 Jennifer looks back at you, crestfallen. She pauses for a long moment before speaking. “I understand. Emily’s education has to come first.”

 

 She slinks off your body and begins cleaning up the table. You watch her, feeling guilty at rejecting her. You help her clean up the dishes and finally break the silence hanging in the room.

 

 “I love you, you know,” you tell her.

 

 “I love you too,” she says, finally smiling.

 

 You both clean-up dinner and wash the dishes, feeling a bit better as you share the tenderness of the moment. Before long, everything is done, and you are both flicking washing up bubbles at each other playfully.

title: ProloguePELesson
text:
You step up to the ropes and appraise the challenge. Mr. Beach looks over as you do so. “It’s simple, Phillips. Climb the rope and get to the top. Do you want a demo?”

 

 You ignore him and step up to the ropes. You watch one of the other girls wrap her legs around it and pull herself up, using her trainers to remain steady. No problem, you think.

 

 Then you see how the girl parts her legs to push herself up with her feet. You see straight up her skirt.

 

 You hear the boys giggling, as they look up high above the gym to see everything too.

 

 More worryingly are the boys opting out of the lesson. They sit on the benches, still dressed in their school uniform. You can see that unlike everyone else, they still have their phones. Covertly, they are filming every girl that goes up the rope.

 

 If you do this, there will be videos of Emily all over the internet, showing her gym briefs to the world.

 

 “Come on, Phillips!” Mr. Beach shouts. “What’s the matter, afraid you’ll break a nail?”

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>
 
 Faced with no choice, you wrap your legs around the rope and pull yourself off the floor. You dig your trainers into rope too, and start pushing your way up, keeping your head against the rope for balance.

 

 You realise the only way to use your legs is to spread them open and push. You glance over at the boys sitting out of PE as you do so, seeing the phones videoing you flashing the class.

 

 You push your face close to the rope to remain balance, noticing it reeks of sweat and odour. Halfway up, you realise that both boys and girls alike have rubbed their genitals against this rope hundreds of times before.

 

 The smells do overwhelm you, but instead of making you nauseous you find yourself grinning. Grinning at how you open your legs to push up, and how you close them again as you stretch out. Grinning at the crowd looking up at you. Grinning at the boys filming you. You can almost smell the boys rubbing their crotches against the rope, and now you are pushing your face against it to inhale their scents.

 

 By the time you make it to the top, you are keeping your legs parted more than you need to, showing your briefs to them in the best possible angle for the shot.

 

 As the stale sweat continues to move up into your nostrils, you feel something odd. You feel desired. Wanted. And it’s nice.

 

 “Well done Phillips!” Mr. Beach says. “Get down and move on to the next exercise.”

 

 You clamber down the rope, finding it easier to breath on the ground. Only then do you think about what you did at the top of that rope. 

 

 Actions

 
 <>
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 <>
 
 
 “I don’t think I’ve got the strength to do this, Mr. Beach,” you tell him. "I’m going to sit this one out.”

 

 “Another forfeit over here, kids!” Mr. Beach cries out, pointing to you. “Phillips is going to be cleaning the gym for you if she’s not careful!”

 

 The other girls complete the challenge. You avoid their smug glances.

 

 Actions

 
 <>
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 <>
 

 Your group leaps at the climbing wall as you approach and a couple of the girls make it halfway to the top within a few moves. You get a feel for the handles you need to grasp on to in order to progress. You begin to climb up the wall yourself.

 

 Everything is going well until you almost get to the top. The wall inclines near the peak and you find yourself bent over as you stretch out with your hand to the nearest handle. You realise that it’s outside the reach of this body. 

 

 You grimace. You’ve worked out your route based on your old physique. In Emily’s smaller body, though, you haven’t got a chance of making it to the top this way.

 

 “Use your feet, Phillips!” you hear Mr. Beach crying from below. “Come on, get your leg up!”

 

 You look at where he’s pointing and you see a handle sticking out, just to the left of your foot. You stretch out cautiously and feel a rush of euphoria when you realise you'll be able to do it --

 

 Then feel your skirt riding up your legs as you stretch.

 

 Taking stock of your situation, you realise that, at least in this position bent over the incline, if you stretch out any further your spandex skirt will ride up. You can't tell exactly how high - you're not an expert in skirts, after all - but you know you’ll be bent over up high in front of the entire class. You can’t imagine that would do Emily’s reputation any good at all.

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>
 
 You grind your teeth as you reach out with your leg.

 

 Quickly, you place your foot against the handle, but just as quickly you feel your skirt run up your bare thigh and snap around your waist. 

 

 Worst still, you realise all too late that stretching so far with your foot has forced you to forward and you smash your head against the incline of the climbing wall.

 

 Through the dizziness you hear a number of cheers and whistles from below, as you are stuck up a wall, bent over with your underwear exposed. 

 

 You try to shrug off the dizziness from your head. The climbing wall stinks of sweat. You can’t help but inhale the odours of the dozens of greasy teenage boys that have used this wall before you.

 

 You reach up a little higher to a handle now in reach and pull yourself slowly. The incline becomes more horizontal as you move upwards and you feel your exposed briefs now rubbing on the hard surface as you pull your body up the wall. The smell of sweat drifts into your nose and you feel yourself taking a deep breath as your briefs rub against the incline.

 

 You murmur as a flutter of sensations emanate out from your vagina, and you realise that you are rubbing your clit against the wall in front of the whole gym class. 

 

 Worse still, as you take another deep inhalation of the smell of teenage boys that is seeped into the equipment, you can't help but look back to the class and coyly smile.

 

 “That’s good enough, Phillips," Mr. Beach cries from down below. “Come down and get ready for another challenge.”

 

 You climb down the wall, taking a deep breath at the bottom. A number of students are looking at you. The girls regard you with pity. The boys with lust. 

 

 What is going on in this gym? you think.

 

 Actions

 
 <>
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 <>
 
 
 You let go of the wall and drop to the mat underneath. “I’m sorry Mr. Beach,” you pant. “I just can’t do it.”

 
 
 He looks at you with a smirk and turns back to the gym. “Another forfeit! Poor Phillips just wants to be cleaning your sweat off the floor!”

 

 You blush as everyone cheers and turn your attention to the remaining challenges.

 

 Actions

 
 <>
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 <>
 

 There’s enough yoga balls for each one of your group. You look at the balls quizzically until Mr. Beach steps up to explain.

 

 “Honestly Phillips, have you never exercised before?” he chastises you. “Get on your back, lay on the ball, and try to keep your balance. It’s not rocket science, is it?”

 

 You look to the other girls and follow their lead. You sit on the ball and slowly lean forward, letting the ball run underneath your back and allowing you to lie on it. 

 

 You look down at your body, noticing your breasts prominently sticking up as the ball forces you to arch your back. You notice a few boys looking at you too.

 

 “Don’t half arse it, Phillips!” Mr. Beach barks, as he stands over you. “The timer only starts when you spread your legs. That’s where the endurance is really tested.”

 

 You look up at him. He stares down at you laid out in front of him. Are you really going to part your legs in this skirt, revealing your briefs, and have him stand between your legs over you in this position?

 <>

 You slide your trainers across the gym floor, hearing them squeak as you widen your stance.

 

 Looking down, you watch your skirt ride up around your hips as you part your legs, revealing your briefs to your PE teacher and the rest of the class.

 

 “Wider!” Mr. Beach cries. “Come on, Phillips. My nan can do better than that, god rest her soul.”

 

 The sound of your squeaking trainers signals for everyone to stare at you, as you push your hips up to spread your legs even further. 

 

 Finally when you can go no more, you look up over your breasts and see Mr. Beach staring at his stopwatch, all the while standing right in-between your thighs.

 

 You feel more exposed than you have in your entire life, laid out like you were waiting for him to climb on top of you. The smell of sweat permeates the air, and you feel the smells wafting into your nostrils. 

 

 Something about the smell and the physical exercise sends your mind reeling, as if in a foggy haze. You feel yourself biting your lip, staring up at Mr. Beach, waiting for him to look down at you.

 

 “That’s enough, Phillips.” He says, after his watch beeps. “You’ve passed this round.”

 

 You roll off the ball and stand up, watching Mr. Beach run across the gym to supervise another challenge. You notice that whilst watching him, you are biting your lip again.

 

 Actions

 
 <>
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 <>
 

 You let the ball slip out from behind your back and you fall to the floor with a thump. Mr. Beach snorts derisively.

 

 “Another forfeit over here!” he shouts to the class. “Phillips just wants to clean up after you lot!”

title: PrologueSchoolCafeteria
text:
**Charlton School - Kitchen**

 [image: ./images/School_Kitchen.png]

 

 You’re thankful that the next item on your schedule is lunch. You follow the other students to the cafeteria and spot Michelle waiting in the lunchline. “Hey Em!” she shouts when she sees you. “Get us a table and I’ll bring us both over something to eat!”

 

 You find a vacant table away from most of the students and sit down. Whilst waiting, you check the remaining lessons for the day, hopeful that now you've found Liz and taken the exam you can soon be home and back looking like, well you.

 

 One more lesson to go, according to the schedule. Physical Education. Next to the class is the number “504” written in Emily’s handwriting.

 

 A shadow falls over the schedule and you look up to see a tall athletic girl in a cheerleader outfit towering over you. “So you’re the girl that Jake has been talking about?”

 

 “Jake?” you ask, trying to recall the name. Then you remember. The jock from the start of the day, who was bullying Dennis outside.

 

 “The quarterback. And my boyfriend,” the girl says. Without asking, she sits down opposite you. “You don’t seem much to me. But…” she looks you up and down. “You might have potential.”

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>

 
 “I’m Christina,” she replies. “Chrissie for short. I run the cheerleader squad at Charlton. Run it with an iron fist.” She smirks.

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <> 
 
 
 
 
 
 “Potential for joining us, of course. You might look like a mousy bookworm, but I can see what Jake was talking about. With a bit of work, you could be a real stunner.”

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <> 
 
 
 
 
 
 Not wanting to complicate Emily’s life, you try to dismiss Christina in the gentlest way possible. “I would love to, but I need to concentrate on my studies.”

 

 Chrissie laughs. “Oh you don’t need to worry about that. Cheerleaders get special privileges with study. In fact, if you wanted to ensure you get a top grade, there’s no better way than to join the team.”

 

 You look back at her. She is certainly beautiful. In your male form, you would be flattered just talking to her. But there’s something predatory about her tone. She makes you feel uneasy. 

 

 “Am I interrupting?" you hear Michelle say as she walks back from the lunch queue, carrying two plates of food. 

 

 Christina eyes her sceptically, but shrugs and gestures to an empty seat. “Please. Join us.”

 

 Michelle puts a tray in front of you. You glance down at the food. Salad and salmon, with a side of carrot sticks. You sigh.

 

 “I was just gauging whether Emily here would be interested in trying out for the squad,” Christina continues. “Maybe you’d be interested too?”

 

 Michelle tucks into her food, smiling as she does so. “Me? A cheerleader! I’m not sure I have the right figure for that.”

 

 “Don’t be silly,” Christina replies. “You would fit right in. And we can work on the more physical attributes that need a bit of work.”

 

 Michelle continues eating, staring up at Christina. “Yes, I would fit right in. You can easily spruce up someone with the right attitude too!”

 

 Christina glances back at you, then to your food. “Aren’t you going to eat that?”

 

 **Actions**

 <>

 <>

 
 You shrug and begin to eat the food. In spite of the bland nature of the meal, it tastes delicious. You soon find yourself eating quickly, savouring every bite.

 

 “So what do you say, Emily?” Christina continues the conversation. “With a bit of work, you’d be a perfect cheerleader. Jake and the boys would love to see you cheer.”

 

 You nod, finding Christina to be very persuasive. You think about yourself in the outfit that Christina is wearing, possibly with some blonde hair, with the football team throwing appreciative glances your way. 

 

 “I’d like that,” you find yourself saying. 

 

 Michelle squeals and hugs you. “This is going to be so much fun, Em. You and I, on the cheerleading squad.”

 

 Christina smiles. “Well, we’re not there yet. We practice everyday after school. You can tryout then. Wear something you can move in. And we’ll see how good you are.”

 

 You find yourself nodding. “I’ll be there.”

 

 Michelle hugs you again. Christina smiles narrowly again and leaves.

 

 Finishing your food, you reflect back on the conversation. You were imagining Emily with blonde hair and in a cheerleader outfit. But you were also imagining it was you.

 

 “Wow!” you hear Michelle say. “Gotta’ run to class, but I’ll text you later. Tomorrow is going to be a hoot!” She skips off, clearly excited by the thoughts of tryouts.

 

 **Actions**

 <> 
 
 You push the plate back and tell Christina you’re not hungry. She frowns, staring at you. “A good cheerleader needs to eat,” she tells you. “After all, it takes a lot of strength and muscle to do what we do.”

 

 “Thanks, but I think I’m going to concentrate on my studies,” you tell her. 

 

 You feel Michelle elbow you in the ribs. “Come on Em! Don’t blow my chance to get on the squad!”

 

 Christina smiles thinly, looking back at you. “Just think it over. We practice everyday after school. You can tryout then. If you change your mind, come along. There’s two spots available.”

 

 “I’m sure I can convince her!” Michelle replies. Christina nods and gets up, walking off.

 

 Michelle doesn’t keep quiet for long, even as she chows down her food. “Come on Em! Did you hear what Chrissie said? I would fit right in. And they can even work on making us look the part!”

 

 You stare back at Michelle, eying her carefully. You remember when you first met her. When Emily brought her round for dinner one night. You remember she was certainly energetic, but not as… excitable. Bouncy?

 

 *Ditzy?*

 

 “I’ll consider it,” you say to appease her. The bell rings. “Now, I have to get to my next class.”

 

 “Text me when you get home!” Michelle shouts after you as you leave, smiling. 
 
 

 **Actions**

 <>

title: PrologueSchoolCorridor
text:
**Charlton School - Main Corridor**

 Michelle leads you through the hallways and past the crowds of students going to lessons. It’s been eight years since you went to school, but even back then things weren't so traditional.
